Title_Description:
PowerRenamer: Bug / Refresh Issue / Broken Reload State When PowerRenamer is used a second time, it remembers the previous rename pattern, unfortunately that remembered pattern is not applied to the selected files renamed list until it has been edited.  **aka broken reload state.**

**Issue:** Bug Seen (Renamed File Preview Column is blank on load instead of previewing remembered pattern that is in the pattern field as it should):
![bug_01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36280055/71561639-e8738080-2a2d-11ea-8b1d-d37c25eb0123.jpg)

**Workaround:** Any Edit to that Field starts immediately applying to the Renamed File Preview Column and it works as expected again:
![bug_02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36280055/71561641-ef9a8e80-2a2d-11ea-8bde-815f20151c02.jpg)

Deleting and re-adding the final character, in this case "p", to the pattern is a workaround to be able to apply/preview the rename from an existing pattern.  remembering the previous pattern is great, but it should ALSO properly preview and be able to apply that pattern in the renamed files list as expected so one can review and apply right away without any weird workarounds or unexpected behavior.

**Thanks for the awesome tool! :-) Love it.**
Creator: JoshuaJarman

Title_Description:
PowerLauncher.exe process holds a handle to AppxManifest.xml 
## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 0.33.1
- PowerToy Utility: PowerLauncher
- Running PowerToys as Admin: no
- Windows build number: [run "winver"] 19042.746

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. Create a new UWP project in VS2019 (nothing fancy)
2. Build and deploy the project locally (i.e. Debug x86), stop debugging.
3. Open Start menu and uninstall the app
4. Close VS2019 and open the project's folder in File Explorer
5. Attempt to delete **obj** and **bin** folders

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

The bin folder is deleted

### 閴 Actual result

The bin folder cannot be deleted because another process has a lock on a file inside the bin folder

After digging in, it appears PowerLauncher.exe has 2 locks on the AppxManifest.xml file (see Screenshot). 


## 棣冩懖 Screenshots


This screenshot should explain it all (open image in new tab to see full size 1695x929)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3520532/111672144-09212500-87f0-11eb-89f9-794c72d639e4.png)


## Workaround

A temporary workaround is to end the PowerLauncher process that is holding the file lock.

1. Open the Resource Monitor app on Windows 10
2. Select the CPU tab
3. Search for the name of the project in the Associated Handles search box (see screenshot above)
4. Right click on the PowerLauncher.exe result and select "End Process"
5. You can now delete the bin folder.

Note: This effectively kills the current PowerLauncher instance. However, you can relaunch a new instance by using your PowerLauncher hot key (Alt+Space).
Creator: LanceMcCarthy

Title_Description:
Fix ColorPicker log file location and include it in the Bug Report ColorPicker have a log file that is created in `C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\ColorPicker` instead of `C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Microsoft\PowerToys\ColorPicker`.

Title_Description:
Auto Update isn't working ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.33.1

### Running as admin

Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

General

### Other Software

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce

The auto-updater says it successfully checks for updates. But that is a false-positive, since it doesn't recognize that a new version is released.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

When a new version is released, it should notify and/or download+install the new version.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

It says it successfully checks for updates. But absolutely fails to recognize when a new version is released or available. If it's supposed to be a staggered release, then this should be clearly declared. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62222189/113575249-e1b6be80-961d-11eb-9efa-133a2fe31516.png)
0.35 was released 4 days before the timestamp in the picture above.
Creator: cloudrootab

Title_Description:
[Welcome to PowerToys]: Name is not defined for the 'Settings' button. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin



### Area(s) with issue?

Welcome / PowerToys Tour window

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps**
1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
3. Navigate to 'Welcome to PowerToys' link present at the right side of the pane and activate it.
4. 'Welcome to PowerToys' window will get open.
5. Navigate to settings button and check whether its name defined or not using Accessibility Insight tool for windows.

**User Impact:Priority-0**
If the object role, state(s), properties, boundary, name, and description are not programmatically determinable, it would be difficult for the platforms that provide Accessibility APIs, and would in turn affect the screen reader dependent users to determine the object properties. 

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BB661D774-60D0-4277-A121-73F986EBEE76%7D&file=MAS%204.1.2%20%E2%80%93%20Name%2C%20Role%2C%20Value.docx&wdLOR=cE56E09CE-4478-4D20-B785-78D1B90569C1&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=0ef90355-b691-404a-a636-c7a80c6dbad1

**Note:**
Same issue is repro for 'Settings' button present at Color picker pane on Welcome to powertoys window.

![MAS4 1 2_Welcomescreen_Name is not defined for settings button](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66783558/114562157-e1589c00-9c8b-11eb-82f6-322c20f6e96c.png)
[MAS4.1.2_Welcome_name is not defined for the settings button.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/6304138/MAS4.1.2_Welcome_name.is.not.defined.for.the.settings.button.zip)



### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Name 'settings' should be defined for the settings button.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Name is not defined for the 'Settings' button.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: Priyanka-Chauhan123

Title_Description:
[Welcome to PowerToys]: Narrator focus does not navigate to 閳ユコicrosoft Docs閳 and 閳ユザowerToys in our release notes閳 link. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin



### Area(s) with issue?

Welcome / PowerToys Tour window

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name**: PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps**
1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Turn on the 'Narrator'.
2. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
3. Navigate to 'Welcome to PowerToys' link present at the right side of the pane and activate it.
4. 'Welcome to PowerToys' window will get open.
5. Navigate using 'Tab' key.
6. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-1**
If any application does not expose information and mechanisms necessary to track focus, text insertion point, and selection attributes (e.g. whether text has been selected for copy/paste) of user interface components,  it would be difficult for the platforms that provide Accessibility APIs, and would in turn affect the screen reader dependent users to determine the focus.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B3C29FC92-CBCC-4A68-9FA6-0F159E3CFEA1%7D&file=MAS%204.2.10%20%E2%80%93%20Tracking%20of%20Focus%20and%20Selection%20Attributes.docx&wdLOR=c15814F13-1B22-4FF5-A80E-802D46292C60&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=8d8a8173-bcfa-4764-b18e-ca7fd7332081

**Note:** Same issue repro with NVDA also.

[MAS4.2.10_Welcome_narrator focus not navigating to links.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/6308528/MAS4.2.10_Welcome_narrator.focus.not.navigating.to.links.zip)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Narrator focus should navigate to 閳ユコicrosoft Docs閳 and 閳ユザowerToys in our release notes閳 link along with keyboard focus navigating via 'Tab' key.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Narrator focus does not navigate to 閳ユコicrosoft Docs閳 and 閳ユザowerToys in our release notes閳 link. 
Only the keyboard focus navigates and narrator focus stays on 'Welcome to PowerToys' item and remain silent.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: Priyanka-Chauhan123

Title_Description:
[Welcome to PowerToys]: In scan mode narrator focus navigates separately to settings icon (stays silent) and to its text which is not required. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin



### Area(s) with issue?

Welcome / PowerToys Tour window

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps**
1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Turn on the 'Narrator'.
3. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
4. Navigate to 'Welcome to PowerToys' link present at the right side of the pane and activate it.
5. 'Welcome to PowerToys' window will get open.
6. Turn on the scan mode of the narrator using 'Caps + Space'.
7. Navigate using up/down arrow key.
8. Navigate to the 'settings' button using arrow key.
9. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-2**
If any application does not expose information and mechanisms necessary to track focus, text insertion point, and selection attributes (e.g. whether text has been selected for copy/paste) of user interface components, it would be difficult for the platforms that provide Accessibility APIs, and would in turn affect the screen reader dependent users to determine the focus.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B3C29FC92-CBCC-4A68-9FA6-0F159E3CFEA1%7D&file=MAS%204.2.10%20%E2%80%93%20Tracking%20of%20Focus%20and%20Selection%20Attributes.docx&wdLOR=c15814F13-1B22-4FF5-A80E-802D46292C60&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=8d8a8173-bcfa-4764-b18e-ca7fd7332081

**Note:** NVDA browse mode is not working.

[MAS4.2.10_Settings_scan mode_separate focus navigates to icon and text of button.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/6308600/MAS4.2.10_Settings_scan.mode_separate.focus.navigates.to.icon.and.text.of.button.zip)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

In scan mode, narrator focus should not navigate separately to settings icon (stays silent) and to its text. Only one complete focus should navigate to 'Settings' button and announce it as 'Settings button'.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

In scan mode narrator focus navigates separately to settings icon (stays silent) and to its text which is not required, as separate focus is navigating to 'settings' button.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: Priyanka-Chauhan123

**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps**
1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Turn on the 'Narrator'.
3. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
4. Navigate to 'Welcome to PowerToys' link present at the right side of the pane and activate it.
5. 'Welcome to PowerToys' window will get open.
6. Turn on the scan mode of the narrator using 'Caps + Space'.
7. Navigate using up/down arrow key on the 'Getting started' and 'Welcome to PowerToys' text.
8. Press 'H' or 'Shift + H' to check the headings defined on the page.
9. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-2**
If headings are not clear and descriptive, it would be difficult for screen reader dependent users to find the information they seek , and cannot understand the relationships between different parts of the content. 

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B9EBE78B9-6AEE-4CCA-908B-52A214B437A8%7D&file=MAS%202.4.6%20%E2%80%93%20Headings%20and%20Labels.docx&wdLOR=c8BB700E9-6F3C-492A-8874-3CACAD96EEB9&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=5a634e83-ba04-4312-8068-478ab13e0e9a

**Note:** Same issue repro for 'color picker' welcome screen. No heading is defined on the page

[MAS2.4.6_Wecome screen_No heading defined on the page.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/6308814/MAS2.4.6_Wecome.screen_No.heading.defined.on.the.page.zip)

![MAS2 4 6_Welcome to powertoys text not defined as heading](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66783558/114668115-f978fb80-9d1d-11eb-8927-11d22120a4e9.png)

![Note_MAS2 4 6_Color picker_no heading is defined](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66783558/114668126-fbdb5580-9d1d-11eb-9c3f-2b069287fb82.png)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Text 'Getting started' and 'Welcome to PowerToys' should be defined as heading.
'Getting started' should be defined as 'H1' and 'Welcome to PowerToys' should be defined as 'H2'.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

No heading is defined on the page, text 'Getting started' and 'Welcome to PowerToys' are not defined as heading.

Title_Description:
[Welcome to PowerToys - Color Picker]: 'Learn more about color picker' link does not have underline or chevron icon. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin



### Area(s) with issue?

Welcome / PowerToys Tour window

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps**

1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
3. Navigate to 'Welcome to PowerToys' link present at the right side of the pane and activate it.
4. 'Welcome to PowerToys' window will get open.
5. Navigate to 'Color picker' item and select it.
6. Now navigate to 'Learn more about color picker' link
7. Observe the issue.

**User Impact:**
If the information is conveyed only through colors, users with color deficiencies will not be able to perceive the correct information of the image. In this case, providing the information conveyed with color through another visual means ensures users who cannot see color can still get the information.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B63F3625C-8722-40A6-8A2A-64181087C047%7D&file=MAS%201.4.1%20%E2%80%93%20Use%20of%20Color.docx&wdLOR=c82B54E93-B1DC-488E-B43A-A8D659AD7EE4&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=8d7d11f4-e687-49ec-9681-b95f057ef4f4

**Observation:** As links 閳ユコicrosoft Docs閳 and 閳ユザowerToys in our release notes閳 present in 'Welcome to powertoys' pane are having underline.

![MAS1 4 1_Color picker_learn more link does not have underline or chevron](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66783558/114677284-c6d40080-9d27-11eb-9d67-a595497f274e.png)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

'Learn more about color picker' link should have underline or followed by the chevron icon.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

'Learn more about color picker' link does not have underline or chevron icon. Only blue color is used to identify it as link.

Title_Description:
[Welcome to PowerToys]: Text 'Toys' of the 'Welcome to PowerToys' is getting cropped at 225% resize mode. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin



### Area(s) with issue?

Welcome / PowerToys Tour window

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Pre-Requisite:**
1. Go to settings > Display settings > Set the resolution to 1280*768.
2. Set the slider value to maximum i.e. 225% (Settings -> Ease of access -> text scaling) and Apply.

**Repro Steps**

1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
3. Navigate to 'Welcome to PowerToys' link present at the right side of the pane and activate it.
4. 'Welcome to PowerToys' window will get open.
5. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-2**
If any application does not support resizing of text without loss of content or functionality, the users with mild visual disabilities who scales the text instead of using the assistive technology would be impacted as zooming will not work as desired.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B5BE8E205-7508-414C-A273-657770321DA0%7D&file=MAS%201.4.4%20%E2%80%93%20Resize%20Text.docx&wdLOR=cD434D0F2-F515-4FD8-B4DA-BA99282968ED&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=e8a7e0cb-a049-4c6a-b020-862f20088e4c

![MAS1 4 4_Text welcome to powertpys is getting cropped](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66783558/114699172-9303d580-9d3d-11eb-8f98-242d9be7098f.png)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Text 'Welcome to PowerToys' should not get cropped and should be properly visible at 225% resize mode setting .

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Text 'Toys' of the 'Welcome to PowerToys' is getting cropped at 225% resize mode setting.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: Priyanka-Chauhan123

Title_Description:
[FancyZones Editor]: 'Create new layout' button does not get visible at High contrast white theme. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Pre-Requisite:**
Set High contrast using Settings -> Ease of Access -> High contrast -> High contrast black and white

**Repro Steps:**

1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
3. Navigate to 'FancyZones' at the left side of the pane and activate it.
4. Now navigate to 'Launch layout editor' button and activate it.
5. FancyZones editor window will get open.
6. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-1**
If any image , icon , hyperlink , text or visual focus disappear when high contrast mode is enabled , will make the UI confusing and difficult for users with low vision to navigate easily to the desired element.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B3870F7C4-7C43-43C6-A9F7-FD73D800BFD0%7D&file=MAS%204.3.1%20%E2%80%93%20No%20Disruption%20of%20Accessibility%20Features.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=fa626c36-15d8-4169-911f-29216b0140e8

**Note:** Issue does not repro for High contrast black theme.

![MAS4 3 1_HC White theme_Fancy zone editor_create layout button not visible](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66783558/114987300-a4bab980-9eb2-11eb-8b71-e4da7f1b3798.png)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

1. 'Create new layout' button should be properly visible at High contrast white theme.
2. Selected layout name and edit button should be properly visible and look like a selected control.
3. Monitor text '1' present at the top should be properly visible.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

1. 'Create new layout' button does not get visible at High contrast white theme.
2. Selected layout name and edit button is not visible and doesn't look like a selected control.
3. Monitor text '1' present at the top is not visible.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: Priyanka-Chauhan123

Title_Description:
[FancyZones]: Narrator does not announce the current color selected for the Zone highlight color button. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps:**

1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Turn on the Narrator.
3. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
4. Navigate to 'FancyZones' at the left side of the pane and activate it.
5. Now navigate to 'Zone highlight color' button.
6. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-2**
If the object role, state(s), properties, boundary, name, and description are not programmatically determinable, it would be difficult for the platforms that provide Accessibility APIs, and would in turn affect the screen reader dependent users to determine the object properties. 

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BEEE97BBD-9990-48A0-8B03-6EA775581AA8%7D&file=MAS%204.2.1%20%E2%80%93%20Object%20Information.docx&wdLOR=cBC823FF2-F30B-4029-A49F-90FCC0AB9FEB&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=d18989b6-71d6-42da-924d-6506167e2826

**Note:** Issue repro for 'Zone inactive color' and 'Zone border color' also.

**Observation:** Issue repro with NVDA also.

[MAS4.2.1_Fancy zone_Narrator not announcing zone color.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/6323807/MAS4.2.1_Fancy.zone_Narrator.not.announcing.zone.color.zip)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Narrator should announce the current color selected for the Zone highlight color button. Narrator should announce it as "Zone highlight color button collapsed selected blue".

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Narrator does not announce the current color selected for the Zone highlight color button. Narrator only announces it as "Zone highlight color button collapsed".

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: Priyanka-Chauhan123

Title_Description:
[FancyZones Editor]: Same name as 'Edit layout' defined for multiple focusable sibling elements. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps**

1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
3. Navigate to 'FancyZones' at the left side of the pane and activate it.
4. Now navigate to 'Launch layout editor' button and activate it.
5. FancyZones editor window will get open.
6. Run 'Accessibility Insight' tool on the application.
7. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-1**
Screen reader users would get impacted and get confused if same name as 'Edit layout'  is defined for multiple buttons.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BB661D774-60D0-4277-A121-73F986EBEE76%7D&file=MAS%204.1.2%20%E2%80%93%20Name%2C%20Role%2C%20Value.docx&wdLOR=cE56E09CE-4478-4D20-B785-78D1B90569C1&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=577e2918-ba37-4bc7-bdd5-df0122160d1f

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Unique name should be defined for each sibling controls.
For E.g. Name as "Template Rows layout" should be defined for Rows layout edit button present under Templates heading.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Same name as 'Edit layout' defined for multiple focusable sibling elements.

FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps:**

**User Impact: Priority-0**
If the content is not operated through a keyboard or keyboard interface, it would not be operable by people with no vision, Some people with hand tremors find using a mouse very difficult , as well as by people who must use alternate keyboards or input devices that act as keyboard emulators. Individuals with low vision would also find it difficult to control it from the keyboard.

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps:**
1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Turn on the Narrator.
3. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
4. Navigate to 'FancyZones' at the left side of the pane and activate it.
5. Now navigate to 'Launch layout editor button and activate it.
6. FancyZones editor window will get open.
7. Navigate to 'Edit layout' button of any layout (say Grid) under Templates and activate it.
8. Edit layout dialog gets open.
9. Navigate to the 'Distance to highlight adjacent zones' edit field and enter the value greater than 1000 say 1500 and press 'Tab key.
10. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-1**
If Screen reader users are not aware that an error has occurred they will not be able to determine what is wrong before encountering the error indicator, thinking that the page simply is not functional. 

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B560A496D-D812-45E2-AF46-46085DBBAA1C%7D&file=MAS%203.3.1%20%E2%80%93%20Error%20Identification.docx&wdLOR=c6B7757E9-540D-425E-8E41-A5D295FB67B3&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=c0f1e800-77ae-4515-8e32-a683d770d505

Error message should get identified for the edit fields of edit layout dialog by entering value other than its defined range.
Entering value greater than 1000 say '1500' error message should get displayed on the screen such as "Value greater than 1000 not allowed".
Also, narrator should announce the minimum and the maximum value of the edit field when focus navigates there.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Error message doesn't get identified for the edit fields of edit layout dialog by entering value other than its defined range.
Entering value greater than 1000 say '1500' and pressing tab key, value automatically gets change to 1000.
Also, narrator does not announce the minimum and the maximum value of the edit field when focus navigates there.

[FancyZones editor - Under Canvas Layout add zone]: Screen reader remains silent and does not provide any confirmation after activating 'Add new zone' button.  ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.35.0"

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
**OS:** Windows 10 Build 21354.1
**App version:** 0.35.0
**App name:** PowerToys
**Screen Reader:** Narrator
**Tool:** Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps:**

1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Turn on the narrator.
3. Application will get open with default list item 'General' selected.
4. Navigate to 'FancyZones' at the left side of the pane and activate it.
5. Now navigate to 'Launch layout editor button and activate it.
6. FancyZones editor window will get open.
7. Navigate to 'Create custom layout' button and activate it.
8. Choose layout type dialog gets open.
9. Select 'Canvas layout' radio button.
10. Now navigate to 'Create' button and press 'enter' key to activate it.
11. Canvas layout  editor window will get open.
12. Navigate to 'Add new zone' button and press enter to activate it.
13. Observe the issue.

**User Impact: Priority-1**
If there is no notification of events relevant to user interactions, changes in the component閳ユ獨 state(s), value, name, description, or boundary it would be difficult for the platforms that provide Accessibility APIs, and would in turn affect the screen reader dependent users to determine the information of any new page , new dialog box etc. 

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/accessibility/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B22302C3B-44F6-4EA5-BF33-524F800B71BE%7D&file=MAS%204.2.12%20%E2%80%93%20Change%20Notification.docx&wdLOR=c50C80C39-3431-462C-9838-E9EA6159866A&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=35585311-410e-41c6-9ccd-93af208b6104

**Observation:** Same issue repro with NVDA

[MAS4.2.12_Under canvas layout_activating add new zone button narrator remains silent.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/6344123/MAS4.2.12_Under.canvas.layout_activating.add.new.zone.button.narrator.remains.silent.zip)

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Screen reader should provide the confirmation after activating 'Add new zone' button like 'new zone added successfully'.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Screen reader remains silent and does not provide any confirmation after activating 'Add new zone' button.

Title_Description:
Microphone unmutes on changing Video Conference Mute toolbar position ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.36.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Settings

### Steps to reproduce

- Join a Teams call. Verify that you're muted.
- Open PowerToys Settings. Go to 'Video Conference Mute' > 'Toolbar' section.
- Change Toolbar position to any other. Toolbar now shows up in new position as expected.
- Go back to Teams call window to see that you're now unmuted. 

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Toolbar position should change without affecting microphone mute state.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

I see that my microphone get unmuted if I change the position of the toolbar while muted on a call (I can see my mic get unmuted in Teams call immediately on changing toolbar position).

- I was able to replicate the issue with both a bluetooth headset (in HFP profile) and a dedicated mic.
- The mic only goes from mute -> unmute when the toolbar position is changed, not reverse.
- Behavior does not depend on the target position being selected.
- I have not tested this against other video conferencing software.

I'm using v0.36.0 on Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042. 

### Other Software

Microsoft Teams Version 1.4.00.9289 (64-bit)
Creator: nevalsar

0.36.0

### Area(s) with issue?

Settings

### Steps to reproduce

Add a new microphone to your system and use it in for example Jitsi Meet.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

It should be muted when the PowerToys Mute tool is used.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

But it doesn't.

I noticed that when you have the "[All]" option selected for microphones, it doesn't mute any new microphones that are attached after PowerToys has started. The new device does show in the selection dropdown though.
As workaround, you can which to any other option in the microphone selection list and then revert to the [All] option: the mute now does work for the expected devices.

This happens for example when you use an external docking solutions where your headset has been attached to.

Title_Description:
Minimize-to-tray app shows empty white window when starting minimized. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.37.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

I've only experienced this with qBittrorrent but it could be a more widespread issue with apps that start minimized and have minimize-to-tray functionality.

Steps to reproduce: (all of them have to apply at the same time)
- **Have "Move newly created windows to their last known zone" setting activated.**
- Set to start minimized.
- Set to minimize to tray.
- Bind qBittorrent to a zone.

If not binded to a zone all functions well.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

When qBittorrent is set to start minimized and "minimize to tray" is enabled it should only show the tray icon on startup.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Instead of just the tray icon, qBittorrent is also visible on the taskbar.

![ss](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/77577601/116602142-ff80f600-a933-11eb-998b-e61d0484e643.jpg)

If you click on it an empty white window shows up.

![ss](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/77577601/116600813-67ced800-a932-11eb-9c7d-8936d4206969.jpg)

If you minimize it again it still doesn't minimize to the tray, and if you close it the app will terminate (even if "close-to-tray" is set!).

However if you click on the tray icon all goes back to normal.

Fancy Zones UI appears when dragging a tab out of Edgium but can't drop the tab into it 

# Environment

```
Windows build number: 19002.1
PowerToys version: 0.14.1.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): Fancy Zones
```

# Steps to reproduce

When dragging a tab out of Edgium to put it in a new window, press Shift and the blue guides for Fancy Zones appear, but you can't drop the tab into one of them.

# Expected behavior

either be able to drop the tab into the zone or not see the zone guides if creating a window and placing it in a zone isn't supported as a single operation

# Actual behavior

the guides appear, suggesting you can drop into a zone, but the tab can't be dropped there, so it's confusing

Title_Description:
[FancyZones] Outlook new email window is snapped to last used zone. This applies to 0.14.1 and also to the current master.

Repro steps:
 - have "Move newly created windows to their last known zone" ON.
 - open Outlook and snap it to a zone.
 - open an email message or create a new email message.

Result:
 - the email message window is snapped to the zone where Outlook is snapped.

Expected:
 - the email message window is opened where it was last used.

Moving the email message window somewhere else will "fix" the problem, subsequent email messages will be opened where they were last used and not snapped to the zone.
Snapping Outlook to a new zone will bring back the bug.

Title_Description:
MSIX: Performance drop on file explorer file selection After installing PowerToys using the MSIX installer, the file explorer UI lags quite a bit when selecting files. It seems to occur at time and at times it doesn't, but almost always occurs on the first use after installation. Disabling PowerRename alone doesn't help either. This performance hit doesn't occur with the MSI installer for the same set of binaries.
# Steps to reproduce
- Install using MSIX
- Open any folder with many files and try selecting a large number with mouse, the UI will get stuck quite a bit.

# Expected behavior
A gif of selecting files after installation is done using the msi installer. The UI is smooth.
![powerrename_msi](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32061677/73582985-a2eb0e80-4444-11ea-9cb0-6cd5dd6f6316.gif)


# Actual behavior
A gif of selecting files after installation is done using the msix installer. The UI isn't smooth.
![powerrename_msix](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32061677/73583004-bdbd8300-4444-11ea-8ff4-6ff09e0d4650.gif)

Even if the perf hit cannot be avoided in case of MSIX, the minimum change to the code should be that disabling PowerRename (and ImageResizer once its out) and any other PowerToys which use context menu handlers should reduce the perf hit.
Creator: arjunbalgovind

Title_Description:
[Color Picker - Editor]: Screen Reader is not announcing 'Copied to Clipboard' message which appear on Screen when user activate 'Copy to clipboard' button. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.44.1"

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

ColorPicker

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
OS: Windows 10 Version Dev
App version: 0.41.1
App name: PowerToys
Screen Reader: Narrator
Tool: Accessibility Insight for Windows

**Repro Steps:**

1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Turn on the narrator.
3. Navigate to 'Color Picker' tab.
4. Then Open 'Color Picker' using defined Shortcut key.
5. Pick any color.
6. Inside Color Picker Editor, Navigate to 'Copy to Clipboard' button.
7. Then activate and Observe the issue.

**User Impact:** -> Priority 1
Screen Reader user are impacted here as they are not informed about the message which appear on screen.

**WCAG Reference:**
https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG21/#status-messages

Observation: Same issue repro with NVDA Screen Reader.

**Attachment:**
[Screen Reader is not announcing 'Copied to Clipboard' message which appear on Screen when user activate 'Copy to clipboard' button..zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/6738108/Screen.Reader.is.not.announcing.Copied.to.Clipboard.message.which.appear.on.Screen.when.user.activate.Copy.to.clipboard.button.zip)

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Screen Reader should announce 'Copied to Clipboard' message which appear on Screen when user activate 'Copy to clipboard' button.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Screen Reader is not announcing 'Copied to Clipboard' message which appear on Screen when user activate 'Copy to clipboard' button. Screen Reader remain silent when message appear on screen.


### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: v-rpundir

The name property must not contain any character in the private Unicode range for 'Activate Color picker' text.

Title_Description:
[Translations] Wrong Korean translations ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.41.4

### Utility with translation issue

Awake

_ps. I can't select 'Awake' on report form 'Localization/Translation issue' . Please update select option._

### 棣冨 Language affected

Korean

### 閴 Actual phrase(s)

#### Wrong translations
The toggle button on 'Awake' is:
* 闉濆牗鍋 姘囬湆 闋冩尗鐗 闈烽灃

#### Mistranslation
The options for selection mode are:
* PC闆 闋嗗嫵鐏 闉濆嫵娲 闉栨棄绗闉濇粚妫 闇愬崐婢 闉涙埁褰婇爟鈺囧归浖.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8789112/124279714-ca3a9380-db82-11eb-9845-8d13e4ebfe98.png)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected phrase(s)

#### Wrong translations
The toggle button on 'Awake' is:
* 闉濆牗鐖 姘囬湆 闋冩尗鐗 闈烽灃

#### Mistranslation
The options for selection mode are:
* PC闆 闋嗗嫵鐏 闉濆嫵娲 闈广倢鐖奸瀽 闇愬崐婢 闉涙埁褰婇爟鈺囧归浖.

### 閳 Why is the current translation wrong

1. 闉濆牗鍋 姘囬湆 闋冩尗鐗(enable Awake)
'闉濆牗鍋' is almost never used. 
I recommend to use same texts of utility translation name '闉濆牗鐖 姘囬湆 闋冩尗鐗'.

2. PC闆 闋嗗嫵鐏 闉濆嫵娲 闉栨棄绗闉濇粚妫 闇愬崐婢 闉涙埁褰婇爟鈺囧归浖.(Your PC operates according to is current power plan)
'闉栨棄绗闉' means 'the way charges are calculated for a particular service.'
I recommend '闈广倢鐖'.
Creator: taerok

### Steps to reproduce

In my case i had the Visual Studio (devenv.exe) as only part of the excluded list.
To reproduce the error: Open PowerToys Settings, Select FancyZones, Scroll down to List of excluded Applications, delete the line with the devenv.exe. Close the Window via the close button in the title bar. 

Reopen PowerToys settings. Select FancyZones again. Scroll down again. The entry is still there, though it was deleted in the action before!

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

If you delete an entry of the list of excluded applications it should be deleted from the list after closing the settings. Maybe there should be an extra "Apply" button to apply the changes to the list directly, so they are stored before closing the Settings Window.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

A deleted line still appears after editing the exclusion list. I found a workaround though, if you change the settings section, the change in the list will be accepted.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: MrZweistein

Title_Description: Design Change: Default Enter Action Have been using Power Rename to do a massive number of file name changes. It's been extremely helpful, especially to be able to do regex changes. One thing has been driving me crazy - the current default action for the enter key in the change window is Cancel. That makes sense when a replace string has not been entered. Not so much when you've entered something and then lose it by hitting enter. Can the default action be changed to Change? If not, could the default action button be bolded or boxed?
Creator: wrldtvlr

Title_Description:
Windows are not opening in their last know zones. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.41.4

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

1. Check that the setting "Move newly created window sto their last known zone" is checked (on) in FancyZones/Window behavior.
2. Open application. (ex. Windows PowerShell)
3. Hold down shift and snap the PowerShell window to a zone
4. Close PowerShell
5. Open PowerShell


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

PowerShell window is opened in the same zone as it was assigned to in step 3 of the reproduction steps.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

PowerShell window is opened at randomly locations every time started.
Same behavior as a system not having FancyZones enabled/installed.

### Other Software

Running on:
Windows 10 Enterprise
Version: 20H2
OS build: 19042.1052

Also tested on Windows 10 Home.
Creator: team-aniar

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

### 閴 Actual Behavior

FancyZones is using a very large amount of CPU.

Title_Description:
PowerToys compiled from source doesn't work correctly on Windows 10 N ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.0.1

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

General

### Steps to reproduce

Build PowerToys from source, using the current master, and install it on a clean version running Windows N.
Try using any of the PowerToys or just opening the settings screen. It won't work.

From the Event viewer and the logs on some of the PowerToys, we can observe the following error:
```
System.BadImageFormatException: Could not load file or assembly 'PowerToysInterop, Version=0.0.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'. An attempt was made to load a program with an incorrect format.
```

This seems to have been caused by the introduction of VCM to master in https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/commit/4e23832d527d4fbcd6323e0ebddf6e59cdd6a44d .
My theory is that it added the Media Foundation library (`Mf.lib`) dependency to PowerToysInterop and that this library is not available in the N editions of Windows 10.

Removing `Mf.lib` from https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/blob/37132c91e65f7e7f5d8e0d62bd81b8e8e2eab8bd/src/common/interop/PowerToysInterop.vcxproj#L58
and commenting this functionality https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/blob/37132c91e65f7e7f5d8e0d62bd81b8e8e2eab8bd/src/modules/videoconference/VideoConferenceShared/VideoCaptureDeviceList.cpp#L36-L74
allowed PowerToys to run correctly in my virtual machine running Windows 10 Home N.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Title_Description: Powertoys causing (almost) hard lockup on lock/login screen ### Microsoft PowerToys version 0.41.4 ### Running as admin - [X] Yes ### Area(s) with issue? General ### Steps to reproduce This was occurring with an out-of-date version also, seemed to start a couple of months ago. Upgrading to newest version has not helped. To my knowledge this seems to happen once the computer has locked for whatever reason - suspend/sleep or inactivity. But doesnt seem to reproduce if you manually lock the computer and attempt to wake it in quick succession. It has happened after manual lock, and attempting to wake the computer the following day. When the computer is woken, the image on the screen is a frozen snapshot of the moment the GPU locked up, so often shows a time in the past. Keyboard is unresponsive - can't get caps-lock hardware LED to trigger. However on at least one occasion, streamed audio continued to play despite this locked up behaviour, so I don't think the O/S has completely frozen. Unsure whether or not RD into desktop would be possible in this state. After spending some time trying to find the culprit it definitely seems to be powertoys. Disabling or uninstalling it, the comp no longer has this issue. May possibly be an issue with the GPU driver. ### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior Computer unlocks without issue. ### 閴 Actual Behavior To my knowledge this seems to happen once the computer has locked for whatever reason - suspend/sleep or inactivity. But doesnt seem to reproduce if you manually lock the computer and attempt to wake it in quick succession. It has happened after manual lock, and attempting to wake the computer the following day. When the computer is woken, the image on the screen is a frozen snapshot of the moment the GPU locked up, so often shows a time in the past. Keyboard is unresponsive - can't get caps-lock hardware LED to trigger. However on at least one occasion, streamed audio continued to play despite this locked up behaviour, so I don't think the O/S has completely frozen. Unsure whether or not RD into dekstop would be possible in this state. There is some relevant errors in event logs, but none that point specifically to Powertoys. Here is a relevant example of the event sequence that typifies the lockup. You can see by timestamps approximate time of the freeze, followed by hard reboot events. Mostly seems to be DCOM timeout errors leading up to the reboot. If you want me to dig out anything else I can give it a go, I couldnt find any minidumps since it isn't actually bluescreening. This could quite possibly be a bug related to interaction with other software I am running but I havent been able to find a combination where powertoys is not locking my system, as long as it's active. ### Other Software _No response_
Creator: e1m5

Title_Description:
[PowerRename] Tracker for UI Updates Needed to Address Accessibility Issues ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.43.0


### Area(s) with issue?

PowerRename


In accordance with the guidance from our internal accessibility team, we're closing the listed bugs as "obsolete" and will use this tracking issue to make sure the functionality is addressed during PowerRename's UI update:
- [x] [Keyboard Navigation - Power Toys - Power Rename]: 'Original/Renamed' header controls present in 'Power Rename' dialog are not accessible using keyboard. #7082
- [x] [Screen Readers - Power Toys - Power Rename]: Screen reader didn't announce state 'Selected/Non-Selected' on activating/Deactivating checkboxes of the list items present in the Preview table. #7118
- [x] [Screen Readers - Power Toys - Power Rename]: The Name property of a focusable element must not be null. #7039

- Disable 'Show in default context menu's' option in PowerRename settings
- Observer that PowerRename is still present in default context menu, but without icon

Note: In config file, this option is called `Hide icon`, so it might be that only description of this option was wrongly changed at some point. Check this out. Also, it doesn't make much sense to have both `Show in default context menu's` and `Show in extended context menu's` options, as turning the latter On will remove PowerRename from default and only show it in extended menu. Title_Description:
FancyZones: windows not matching new zone size on layout change after restart. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.45.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones, FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

1. Set PowerToys to run at startup (issue occurs in both admin mode and user mode).
2. Turn on FancyZones _hold shift to activate zones while dragging_ option.
3. Turn on _when zone layout changes windows assigned to a zone will match new size_ option.
4. Create 2 custom FancyZones layouts.
5. Assign a quick switch number to each of the custom layouts.
6. Restart the machine.
7. Once booted do not interact with the PowerToys UI in any way.
8. Open a window and assign it to a zone with Shift+Drag.
9. Switch zone layouts using quick switch shortcut e.g. `CTRL+WIN+ALT+number`.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

The window should resize to match the new layout when the zone layout is changed after a restart via quick layout shortcut keys.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

The window does not change size to match layout changes.

Window size matching can be restored by opening up the PowerToys settings window and clicking on the FancyZones tab in the side bar. 

If the window set up in the steps to reproduce does not match the current size of the zone it is assigned to when you click on the FancyZones tab it will suddenly resize to match as the functionality is restored. After this zone resizing works as expected until the next reboot.

### Other Software

_No response_

PowerToys Run

### Steps to reproduce

Open PT Run and typing queries that can't be split on `\` or doesn't match a root key like "HKCU":
- `:d`
- `:hkcu/`
- `:hkcu>`

**Note:** 
- `:` is the activation command for the plugin.

Title_Description:
Reporting a crash while using FancyZones ### Microsoft PowerToys version

v0.45.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

I installed a new version by downloading the executable.  Went from 43 to 45.  I changed some settings in other apps, then modified FancyZones for my setup, saved the settings, and then hit the 'X' to close the program.  Then it crashed and asked me to send in a report.  I didn't have a Github account so I created one.  I don't know if there was another way to report a crash without a Github account.  When I used the URL in the message box, that's what I typed to get here.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Expecting the program to close and for me to get back to normal computing activities.

For what it's worth, I had rebooted the computer and nothing else was running at the time except antivirus, Trend Micro.  And THANK YOU for FancyZones.  I needed this program so much!  Thank you thank you thank you.  If I knew anything about programming I'd definitely volunteer to help out.  BTW, is there a suggestion area or feature request area anywhere for this?  I have one suggestion.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Program crashed, screen appeared like there was a gray haze over it, you know, when things are like, grayed out.  And the "your program crashed go here to report it" etc.

Dragged and dropped the crash log to this window.  Idk if it worked tho.

Title_Description:
Auto-Resize Windows Feature Breaks When Using Microsoft Teams ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.45

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

1. Ensure the auto-resize window feature is turned on and working.
2. Start Microsoft Teams and join a video call.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Microsoft Teams windows should auto-resize properly. If this is not possible, then, at a minimum, other windows on the desktop should still resize correctly.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

The auto-resize window feature in FancyZones breaks not just for Teams, but for all other open windows too.
Another user reports the same issue. See below:

I installed v0.45 and it solved the problem at first. But next day, it again stopped working (changing dispositon didn't changed windows sizes). If I open PowerToys, go to FancyZones, uncheck the feature, and re-check the feature, then all windows resize again immediately. But it quickly stops working again.
I think the problem can be linked to Teams: when I uncheck/recheck the feature, sometimes I get a colored rectangle appearing in the top-left corner of a zone, always on top all windows, and impossible to get rid of, except when I quit Teams. I then tried to use fancyZones with Teams off, and no more problems until I relaunch Teams.

_Originally posted by @helaersr in https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/8552#issuecomment-919011850_

### Other Software

Microsoft Teams Version 1.4.00.11161 (64-bit)
Windows 10 - 10.0.19043 Build 19043

Title_Description:
[Color Picker]: Narrator announces irrelevant information about the hotkey shortcut for the color picker utility when the focus navigates to the 'Activation behavior' dropdown. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.45.0

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

ColorPicker

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
OS: Windows 11 Version Dev (22454.1000)
App version: 0.45.0
App name: Power Toys
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Launch 'Power Toys' application.
2. Turn on Narrator.
3. In Color picker tab, navigate to 'Activation shortcut' dialogue using keyboard.
4. Observe Narrator's announcement for the control.

**User Impact:**
If the correct information and relationships are not provided, it would be difficult for people with different disabilities as the information and relationships that are implied by visual or auditory formatting will not be preserved when the presentation format changes. Having these structures and these relationships programmatically determined or available in text ensures that information important for comprehension will be perceivable to all.  

**Guidelines Reference:**
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/info-and-relationships.html

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87321414/134302277-b926fa49-8720-4c32-aa4b-158a2426da1d.mp4




### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Narrator should not announce irrelevant infromation about the hotkey shortcut when focus navigates to the control. It should announce, "Activation behavior group, expanded."

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Narrator announces irrelevant information about the hotkey shortcut for the color picker utility when the focus navigates to the 'Activation Shortcut' dropdown. It announces, "Ctrl + Shift+ Y,  Activation behaviour group"

### Other Software

Creator: Priyanshu073

Title_Description:
[Color picker utility]: Incorrect method of keyboard navigation observed on Color picker utility dialogue on 'Pick color from screen', 'Close'  ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.45.0

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

ColorPicker

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
OS: Windows 11 Version Dev (22454.1000)
App version: 0.45.0
App name: Power Toys
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**

1. Launch 'Power Toys' application.
2. Launch color picker utility using shortcut hotkeys, i.e. 'Ctrl+ Shift+ Y'.
3. Select any color on screen, and navigate to color picker utility dialogue.
4. Navigate to the controls using keyboard and observe the issue.

**User Impact:**
If at least one sequence of the content that makes sense is not programmatically determined, it may confuse or disorient users when assistive technology reads the content in the wrong order, or when alternate style sheets or other formatting changes are applied.   

**Guidelines Reference:**
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/meaningful-sequence.html

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87321414/134328352-edb50826-7869-4f06-8ac1-fab879696c8a.mp4



### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Keyboard focus indicator should move in a logical and meaningful manner while navigating using keyboard. Expected behavior will be:

- Keyboard focus should not move to 'Copy to clipboard' button using down arrow keys from the darkest shade control. It should only navigate when user pressed tab key to navigate further.
- Focus should either navigate to Color history buttons form 'Pick a color from screen' button using tab and Shift+ tab key and not with arrow keys or it should move both ways up and down using arrow keys. 
- Keyboard focus should navigate to Close dialogue button.
- On pressing left/ right arrow keys from lightest and darkest color shade pallet controls focus should either move to the lightest or darkest color or it should remain on the same control itself(recommended).

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Incorrect method of keyboard navigation observed on Color picker utility dialogue on 'Pick color from screen', 'Close', 'Copy from clipboard' and other controls. The issues were as follows:

- Keyboard focus moves to 'Copy to clipboard' button using down arrow keys from the darkest shade control.
- Focus navigates to Color history buttons form 'Pick a color from screen' button using down arrow key.
- Keyboard focus does not navigate to Close dialogue button.
- On pressing left/ right arrow keys from lightest and darkest color shade pallet controls focus moves to color history pane.

Screen Reader: Narrator
Tool: Accessibility Insights for Windows

**Repro Steps:**
1. Launch 'Power Toys' application.

4. Using numpad or mouse select a color on screen to open the utility dialogue.
5. On the dialogue navigate to Copy to clipboard button and observe Narrator's speech.

If instructions or labels does not clearly identify the controls in a form, the users will not know what input data is expected. The pages will look cluttered with unnecessary information and   people with disabilities will miss important cues and instructions

https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/labels-or-instructions.html

A proper relevant and sufficient help text should be defined for the 'Copy to clipboard' button so that when screen reader's focus navigates to the control, screen reader announces, "Copy to clipboard button, hex color format, #ffffff".

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Insufficient help text defined for 'Copy to clipboard' button on Color picker utility pane. Screen reader announces, "Copy to clipboard button #ffffff". Hence user doesn't gets to understand the format of the color code.

**Repro Steps:**

1. Launch 'Power Toys' application.
2. Turn on Narrator.

**User Impact:**
If instructions or labels does not clearly identify the controls in a form, the users will not know what input data is expected. Hence the labels need to be associated with the interactive controls.

**Guidelines Reference:**

Title_Description:
[Fancy Zones]: No boundry around color and dropdown boundry is required for users to distinguish between them on Zone Preview color dropdowns. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.45.0

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
OS: Windows 11 Version Dev (22454.1000)
App version: 0.45.0
App name: Power Toys
Screen Reader: Narrator
Tool: CCA tool from Accessibility insights for windows

**Repro Steps:**

1. Launch 'Power Toys' application.
2. On left side Navigation pane navigate to Fancy zones menu item using keyboard and select it.
3. After that navigate on the fancy zones pane and then navigate to Zone Opacity color dropdown under Zones heading and check the color contrast of the color fill in the dropdown with its background.

**User Impact:**
If a minimum luminosity contrast ratio of 3,5:1 is not provided between any non-text control and its background, it would be difficult people with moderately low vision to read the text. Good luminance contrast accommodates diverse color deficiencies and provides contrast that is independent of color perception.  

**Guideline Reference:**
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/non-text-contrast.html

![Code snippet - No boundry around color and dropdown boundry is required for users to distinguish between them on Zone Preview color dropdowns](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87321414/134508398-7d818d8d-d45b-4fb9-9164-c7b1bd029ce9.png)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

A boundry around color and dropdown boundry is required for users to distinguish between them on Zone Preview color dropdowns. If a solid bold boundry in black color would be present it would be easier for low vision users to distinguish the color easily.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

No boundry around color and dropdown boundry is required for users to distinguish between them on Zone Preview color dropdowns. The contrast ratio due to this is 1.028:1 for white color.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: Priyanshu073

Title_Description:
CTRL+ALT+WIN+[Key] is only showing current zone not switching to new zone layout ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.47.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

I have 2 custom zones set on keys 2 (2 zones) and 3 (3 zones).

I have confirmed they are assigned these values by going into the zone editor.

Press CTRL+ALT+WIN+3 or CTRL+ALT+WIN+2 to change number of zones.

![Screenshot (28)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47402032/135353140-93eedb65-1c99-4354-9f8e-b4cdcaeec3e7.png)
![Screenshot (29)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47402032/135353143-fb57799a-a29c-4588-8e4b-9591bd073c74.png)
![Screenshot (30)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47402032/135353144-0bd43414-7170-4ae8-b35f-e1869db56d21.png)
![Screenshot (31)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47402032/135353147-b1934da5-d146-4992-a37c-c84f224a8a69.png)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Press CTRL+ALT+WIN+2 and change to my custom 2 zones.

Press CTRL+ALT+WIN+3 and change to my custom 3 zones.



### 閴 Actual Behavior

press CTRL+ALT+WIN+2, or CTRL+ALT+WIN+3 the screen flashes with whatever zones are currently being used, and doesn't change the number of zones.


### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: nztut

Title_Description:
'Run' does not work with win+space combo ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.47.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

PowerToys Run

### Steps to reproduce

1. Set the activation shortcut to Win+Space
2. Try with win+space but not works, instead the input language is changed (the win10 default behavior)
3. Set the activation shortcut to Alt+Space
4. Try with Alt+space and the run dialog shows.
5. Restarted both PowerToys and Windows, but Win+Space still not works.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Both shortcut should works, as they did in 0.45.0

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Win+Space does not work, only Alt+Space works.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: kalokng

PowerToys Run

Screen Reader: Narrator

1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.

4. Navigate to 'Direct Activation Command' Edit field.
5. Now, Navigate back to 'Calculator' toggle button and now activate with 'Enter' Key.

**Observation**
When the user presses enter key on the toggle button, the list item is getting Expanded and Collapsed, and toggle button is turning on and off with space key.

**User Impact:**
When a functionality is getting disrupted due to a control, it would be difficult for PWD users to activate such controls.

When the user presses enter key on the toggle button, the toggle button is getting collapsed and expanded with Enter key.

Title_Description:
[PowerToys Run]: Keyboard Focus goes out of sight if no search result is available. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.45.0

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

PowerToys Run

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
OS: Windows 11 Version Dev (22468.1000)
App version: 0.45.0
App name: Power Toys
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Launch 'PowerToys' application.
2. Navigate to 'PowerToys Run' and activate it.
3. Navigate to "Search this list" under plugins list and Search random value, e.g. 'xacd' and activate it.
4. Press' tab key' and Observe the Keyboard focus. 

**User Impact:**
Applications shall expose information and mechanisms necessary to track focus, text insertion point, and selection attributes (e.g. whether text has been selected for copy/paste) of user interface components. Where the platform provides accessibility APIs (for example, UIA on Windows) the information and mechanisms necessary to track focus, text insertion point, and selection attributes of user interface components must be provided to the accessibility APIs.. it would be difficult for AT dependent users.

**Guideline Reference:**
https://liquid.microsoft.com/Web/Object/Read/MS.Accessibility/Requirements/04.02.10

**Attachments**
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/91203131/136390262-df31f1f5-d57a-4bdc-b224-b15ebcb8ba1a.mp4

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Keyboard focus should shift to next interactive element.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

The Keyboard focus is getting lost if not result is available and tab key is pressed.

_No response_

0.45.0

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

PowerToys Run

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
OS: Windows 11 Version Dev (22468.1000)
App version: 0.45.0
App name: Power Toys
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Launch 'Power Toys' application.
2. Now, Turn On High Contrast Mode.
3. On left side Navigation pane navigate to 'PowerToys Run' menu item and select it.
5. Observe the Text in High Contrast.

**Note:**
This Issue Repro across the app.

**User Impact:**
Where software provides a user interface it shall provide sufficient modes of operation that use user preferences for platform settings for colour, contrast, font type, font size, and focus cursor except for software that is designed to be isolated from its underlying platforms., Hence, PWD will get confused in High Confused.

**Guideline Reference:**
https://liquid.microsoft.com/Web/Object/Read/MS.Accessibility/Requirements/04.03.01

**Attachments:**
![Test is not adopting High Contrast Mode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/91203131/136668212-f22b1215-058e-4c40-9457-8131e2f02d5d.jpg)


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

The text appearing should not be differentiable. it should properly adapt the high Contrast mode

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Text is appearing differently in comparison to background, as Text is not adopting High Contrast Mode.

0.49.0

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Keyboard Manager

### Steps to reproduce

When you update to latest version which is 0.49.0 it adds new feature called Video Conference Mute. The default shortcut for  "Mute camera and microphone" is Windows+N and that overlaps with the main Windows shortcut which is for Notification Center.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

It has to open this toolbar or notification center.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64617514/139328649-151db66b-15fa-4477-97fa-b041ca31e46e.png)

Because it overlaps with the notification center shortcut none of the actions happens. I used Win+Shift+M personally because Win+M and Win+Shift+M basically does the same thing with Win+D so I don't use it anyways.

Title_Description:
With FancyZones version 0.15.1 I can no longer cycle through different pre-defined layouts with keyboard shortcut # Environment

```
Windows build number: 10.0.17134.1304
PowerToys version: 0.15.1
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): FancyZones
```

I was previously using version 0.14, but before installing version 0.15.1 I did uninstall PowerToys manually and then delete any configuration left in registry (HKCU\Software\SuperFancyZones) and on disk (%LocalAppData%\Microsoft\PowerToys).

# Steps to reproduce

In version 0.14 of PowerToys I would first apply a set of pre-defined layouts that I wanted to be able to quickly switch between, by doing the following steps:
- `Edit zones`, in the `Templates` tab, select `2` as number of zones, select `Columns` layout, and click `Apply`.
- `Edit zones`, in the `Templates` tab, select `3` as number of zones, select `Columns` layout, and click `Apply`.
- `Edit zones`, in the `Templates` tab, select `4` as number of zones, select `Columns` layout, and click `Apply`.

# Expected behavior

In version 0.14 of PowerToys I could use keyboard shortcut Win+Ctrl+2, Win+Ctrl+3 or Win+Ctrl+4 to activate one of the layouts that I previously had applied, as documented:
```
Win+Ctrl+<Number> | Cycles through saved layouts with the corresponding number of zones
```
E.g. Win+Ctrl+2 would flash the 2 zone columns layout, and I could snap windows to 2 zones. Then Win+Ctrl+3 would flash 3 zone columns layout which I then could snap windows to.

# Actual behavior

In version 0.15.1 Win+Ctrl+<Number> only flashes the layout last applied from Edit zones dialog, unable to change the active layout.

# Additional comments

I am not sure if it even was intended to work the way I used it in version 0.14, or what "saved layouts" is referring to exactly (perhaps only custom layouts or something). The user interface would not show which layouts I had applied and was available to cycle through, the only way to see was either to test it using the keyboard shortcut or to try to make sense of the configuration stored in registry.

I understand the storage of zone configuration has moved from registry to file. In previous version I could see my applied layouts being added as binary values below the HKCU\Software\SuperFancyZones\ScreenWidth_ScreenHeight key. In the new version I do not see any similar information being added to the zones-settings.json file.
Creator: albertony

Title_Description:
Investigate disk usage with Awake ### Description of the new feature / enhancement

Currently, PowerToys Awake starts working on the startup. It would be great to have it started after a set time like 15-20 mins.

### Scenario when this would be used?

On my machine which heavily relies on Superfetch to optimize performance, I'm used to having a decent startup time on my machine while it caches my commonly used stuff since my usage is predictable and the same 90% of the time (Visual Studio, Edge (Chromium), Windows Terminal, etc.). However, recently I started noticing that the startup time is increased significantly and the Disk Usage doesn't come down even after almost 30 mins. I looked at the disk usage and it looked like Awake was keeping the disk busy. 

I tested my hypothesis by having awake disabled at startup (from the Enable Awake Setting) and manually enabling it after 5 mins. I tested it over multiple restarts to confirm the behavior. This approach didn't have any visible impact on the performance of my machine.

### Supporting information

_No response_
Creator: abhisheksiddhu

Title_Description:
Learn more about administrator mode link should not require administrator mode ### Description of the new feature / enhancement

The Settings > General page include options for administrator mode. By default, this is disabled. It's not clear to users why one would want to enable administrator mode and the settings dialog offers a helpful 'Learn more about administrator mode' link. Unfortunately, it seems that this link is actually only usable/clickable when you are actually running in administrator mode.

The 'Learn more about administrator mode' link should be usable in all modes.


### Scenario when this would be used?

A non-administrative user trying to understand the reasons to consider running as administrator.

_No response_

Title_Description:
Certain apps closed in a FancyZone zone open maximized ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.51.1

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

Win10 21H2 19044.1387. Two monitors; on my main monitor, I have three zones: left, center and right.

For inbox apps Microsoft Store, Camera, Calculator, Settings, Mail, Calendar, Alarms and Clock, Photos, and also Store apps OneNote, myTube!, Code Writer, Naturplay Calculator, Home Remote, Adobe Sketchbook, Ink Calendar. Does NOT affect Office, PWA's, Affinity Designer, Zoom, ArcGIS, and many other apps.

Open the app. Use FancyZones to fit the app into a zone or pair of adjacent zones. Close the app.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

App should open in that FancyZone zone only.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

_[with "Move newly created windows to their last known zone" **un**toggled]_ App opens maximized. (Not fullscreen, just maximized.)

_[with "Move newly created windows to their last known zone" toggled]_ App opens in rightmost two zones invariably (even if it was closed in only one zone, or in another pair of adjacent zones).

The issue does not appear if the app is resized in any way, or moved to be outside any FancyZone zone. In that case, closing the app and opening it again results in the app appearing exactly where you closed it as expected.

Title_Description:
PowerToys no longer previews PDF files in Outlook after uninstalling Adobe Acrobat Reader ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.53.3

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

PDF Preview

### Steps to reproduce

1. Installed PowerToys (already a while ago)
2. Enabled PDF preview in PowerToys File Explorer add-ons module, right after installation of PT.
3. Also enabled PDF thumbnails in PowerToys File Explorer add-ons module
4. Set Microsoft Edge browser as the default handler for PDF files.
4. Open Microsoft Outlook for Windows.
5. Open an e-mail message which has a PDF-file attached, and click on that PDF file.
6. A PDF file preview is shown, as expected.
7. Exit Outlook.
7. **Installed Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**
8. Open Outlook.
9. Open an e-mail message which has a PDF-file attached, and click on that PDF file.
10. A PDF file preview is shown, as expected.
11. **Uninstalled Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**
12. Open Outlook and same message with PDF attached. Click on PDF file.
13. Error messages is shown: "The file cannot be previewed because there is no previewer installed for it".
14. Opened Outlook options via File/Outlook Options/Trust Center. Click on button "Trust Center Settings".
15. Select "Attachment Handling" in menu. Made sure that "Turn off Attachment Preview" is unchecked.
16. Click on button "Attachment and Document Previewers".
17. Now the problem appears: there is no "PDF Previewer" option, but there should be one. PDF files can no longer be previewed in Outlook, although the settings in PowerToys are correct.

It seems that Uninstalling Adobe Acrobat may have removed the PDF Preview Handler from Outlook. But PowerToys does not put it back.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

I would expect that installing and subsequently uninstalling Adobe Acrobat would not cause PowerToys to no longer be able to preview PDF files in Outlook for Windows.

(Note: previewing PDF files in the Windows File Explorer still works).

### 閴 Actual Behavior

It seems that Uninstalling Adobe Acrobat has removed the PDF Preview Handler from Outlook. But enabling PDF file preview in PowerToys does not put this capability back.

### Other Software

Microsoft Outlook for Windows version 2112 (Build 14729.20194 Click-to-Run).
Creator: paul-van-cotthem

Title_Description:
Disabled feature stilling occupying its activation shortcut ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.55.0

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Mouse Utilities

### Steps to reproduce

I have personally tested and was able to reproduce this issue on both "Mouse highlight" and "Mouse Pointer Crosshairs".

To reproduce, for any feature with an Activation shortcut, such as "Mouse Pointer Crosshairs":
1. Set the activation shortcut to any combination such as "Ctrl+P"
2. Set the same shortcut in any other application (For example "Ctrl+P" is the default print shortcut for many browser)
3. Disable said feature and try pressing the the shortcut

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Shortcut (e.g. Ctrl+P) of disabled feature should be received by other applications (e.g. browser) as normal (e.g. open Print Dialog).

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Shortcut is not received by any other application. Nothing happens.

Title_Description:
MouseCrosshair shortcut likely interferes with US-Intl keyboard layout ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.55.0

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Mouse Utilities

### Steps to reproduce

This is a may be bug, as it could be anything, but here is what I think happened:

Setup: 

- keyboard layout US-International 
  -  Notably: The right alt key is used as AltGr, which encodes as "Ctrl(Right) and Alt(right)" on an OS level.

Steps:

- Download new Powertoys (with crosshair mouse disabled)
- try to type an 鏋 (o_umlaut) wich is altGr+P

Workaround:

- changed the mousecrosshair keyboard shortcut and enabled then disabled it. After that it was gone. 鏋

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

An 鏋 is typed

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Nothing happens

### Other Software

firefox, random Texteditors. It's really about the typing.
Creator: marvin-marx

Mouse Utilities

Turn on Pointer Crosshairs and turn it off, move the mouse somewhere else, then turn it back on. It happens sporadically for me. Seems to happen consistently when the window in focus has not been changed.
Here's a bug report in case it helps: 
[PowerToysReport_2022-02-03-14-04-06.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/7998589/PowerToysReport_2022-02-03-14-04-06.zip)

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Crosshairs to appear on mouse pointer.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

"Up to date" when blocked from network ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.55.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

General

### Steps to reproduce

Click "Check for updates" when
- PowerToys is out of date
- PowerToys is blocked from network access (in my case, via firewall rules set by TinyWall)

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Updater should report that it was unable to query the update server, or at least that the check failed

I use TinyWall, which only allows network access for specifically whitelisted programs. As far as I understand, it blocks access using Windows Firewall. I'd run more tests, but I updated it already; I'd have to wait for the next one :P

Title_Description:
[FancyZones] Reset template layout settings on reboot  ### Microsoft PowerToys version

v0.55.1

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones, FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

I have three portrait-mode monitors, numbered 1(1440x3392), 2(1440x2512), 3(1440x2512) by FancyZones Editor.  Display settings labels these 3, 1, 2 - but I will refer to the FZ numbering in this bug.

I use the rows layout on all monitors, with no space around zones and 20 pixels highlight distance.  Monitor 1 has 3 rows, while monitors 2 and 3 have 2 rows each.

BUG: Whenever I reboot, monitor 1 changes to 2 rows to match the others.
EXPECTED: Layout should be preserved over reboots.

BUG: If I then "Launch layout editor", change monitor 1 to be 3 rows, and close the editor, all monitors now have 3 rows.  Clicking the other two monitors indicates that they are set to two rows, but they actually end up with 3 rows unless I edit and save the layout for each monitor.
EXPECTED:  Changing the layout for one monitor should not affect the other two monitors.

WORKAROUND: I have to edit the layout of each monitor and click Save to return to the 3/2/2 rows layout.  This is super annoying.

RELATED:  This behavior has started in the last few days.  Previously the layout was preserved, but after reboot it would divide up the screen as if there was no taskbar resulting in zones behind the taskbar; simply launching the layout editor after each reboot fixed that in the past, but not this new issue.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

1.  Layout should be preserved over reboots.
2. Changing the layout for one monitor should not affect the other two monitors.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

1. After rebooting, one of my monitors has layout changed.
2. After bug 1 above, changing the layout of that one monitor affects all monitors.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: slambert-msft

Title_Description:
Unexpected font size/zoom level change when using Fancy Zones ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.55.1

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones

### Steps to reproduce

Open [WSLTTY](https://github.com/mintty/wsltty) and try to snap it to a fancy zone (hold shift while dragging and releasing the window).

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

The window should snap to the zone and resize, but the zoom level should not change within the window.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

The window resizes and positions itself properly, but the font size changes. It's as if the ctrl key was held down while scrolling. This bug is not present with the Windows CMD prompt nor with the default WSL terminal, because those programs do not support changing the font size without changing the window size in the same way. In WSLTTY, holding the ctrl key while scrolling the mouse wheel can change the font size of the terminal without changing the size of the window. There is some bug with FancyZones that causes the font size to change in WSLTTY when snapping. This bug may present itself in other applications too, but I have only noticed it here.

### Other Software

[WSLTTY](https://github.com/mintty/wsltty)
[WSL](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/about)
Creator: nullromo
