Title_Description:
[Power toys - Fancy Zones]: Screen reader announces insufficient information while navigating on Appearance selection pane. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.55.2

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

**Test Environment:**
OS: Windows 11 Version Dev (22538.1010)
App version: 0.55.2
App name: Power Toys
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**

1. Navigate on desktop tool bar using keyboard and navigate to Show hidden icons combo box and activate it.
2. Now navigate to Power toys Fancy Zones on navigation pane and activate it.
3. Press the shortcut to activate fancy zones editor.
4. Navigate to Create a New Layout button and activate it.
5. On the dialog name the layout and activate create button.
6. Turn on Narrator.
7. On layout pane, navigate to layouts using Ctrl+Tab key and verify if narrator announces sufficient information about the resizing of pane or not.

**User Impact:**
If the correct information and relationships are not provided, it would be difficult for people with different disabilities as the information and relationships that are implied by visual or auditory formatting will not be preserved when the presentation format changes. Having these structures and these relationships programmatically determined or available in text ensures that information important for comprehension will be perceivable to all.  

**Guideline Reference:**
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/info-and-relationships.html

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87321414/155478191-6cf8972d-1a4b-4186-a416-57bc724e31c7.mp4




### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Screen reader announces insufficient information while navigating on Appearance selection pane. It should announce the information about how to move/ crop the pane size, like use left or right to move pane size. Also screen reader should announce the information about the pane size, like 'Area 1 230 x 540, Area 2 450 x 540.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Screen reader announces insufficient information while navigating on Appearance selection pane. It does not announce the information about how to move/ crop the pane size. Also screen reader does not announce the information about the pane size.

Cannot modify files because the file is open in Preview Handler Surrogate Host when developer files preview is enabled ### Microsoft PowerToys version

Developer file preview

### Steps to reproduce

When Enable developer files preview is enabled, any attempts to modify a file that is actively being previewed in Explorer will fail (at least .txt files). File modifications that I found that will fail include renaming the file and trying to delete the file.

Renaming steps:

1. Create a new text document (right-click -> New -> Text Document) or find an existing file.
2. The new file is pre-selected to be renamed. You can also see that the preview pane is previewing the empty file.
3. Attempt to rename the file.
4. The action cannot be completed: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18315081/156296291-89ac714a-66f1-4625-8e78-4c4b44acac97.png)

This error also appears when renaming a file by going into the file's Properties dialog.

Same thing when attempting to delete the file:

1. Select the file in Explorer. Confirm the preview pane is previewing the file.
2. Try to delete the file.
3. The action cannot be completed:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18315081/156296324-fdda635c-b310-4da0-8f54-c498dafc8003.png)

Other actions such as copy/paste seem to work as expected.

Bug report: 
[PowerToysReport_2022-03-01-21-32-01.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/8166613/PowerToysReport_2022-03-01-21-32-01.zip)

(I did search for an existing issue but couldn't find one, apologies if this is a duplicate).

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Attempts to rename (via right-click or F2) or delete a file succeeds and the file is renamed or deleted respectively.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

The action fails because the file is open in Preview Handler Surrogate Host

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: sphars

Title_Description:
[ColorPicker] CIEXYZ values should be labeled in upper case "XYZ" instead of "xyz" ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.56.2

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

ColorPicker

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to ColorPicker settings
2. Turn on CIEXYZ
3. Pick a color, let's say, #777777
4. Check the CIEXYZ reading

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

The result should be shown as upper case letters `XYZ`.

```
XYZ(17.5335, 18.4475, 20.0904)
```

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Instead, the result is displayed as lower case letters `xyz`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1808930/158169295-f4eab420-2c05-4db4-8c65-6b400b6e2110.png)

### Why we need to be serious about case sensitivity?

In CIE color system, `XYZ` and `xyz` are two different things.
`XYZ` can be converted to `xyz` or `xyY`. (`xyY` is more commonly used than raw `XYZ` values.)
```python3
x = X / (X + Y + Z)
y = Y / (X + Y + Z)
z = Z / (X + Y + Z)
Y = Y
```

`xyY` can be converted back to `XYZ`.
```python3
X = x * Y / y
Y = Y
Z = (1 - x - y) * Y / y
```

)

After uninstall Video Conference Mute should not be shown on video source selections in zoom , hangout , teams etc. 

### 閴 Actual Behavior

 Video Conference Mute showing as default video source selection in zoom , hangout , teams etc.

Title_Description:
Fast inputs break keyboard manager ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.56.2

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Keyboard Manager

### Steps to reproduce

Use Keyboard manager to assign keyboard combination:
Shift+A => Shift+Q
Shift+S => Shift+W

Open editor (or any other input), hold Shift, then hit A and S in quick succession.
On screen, "QW" appears.
Press Shift+A again. 

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Keyboard manager recognises mapped keyboard combination and "Q" appears on screen.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

"A" appears on screen. Keyboard manager stops interpreting any keyboard combinations from now on.
Restarting Powertoys does not solve the issue, only a full system reboot works for me.

The above example is just for easy reproduction, it often breaks another import workflow for me.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: julianwn

Title_Description:
PowerToys kept restarting and launching UAC to run as admin during the startup of user not in local admin group, blocking the system. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.56.2

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

General

### Steps to reproduce

Create a user A and add it to the local admin group.
Log in the user A, Install the Powertoys and enable option to run as admin.
Restart Log in as user B with admin access, and remove User A from the local admin group.
Restart. Log in as user A, the PowerToy launches the UAC asking the user A to input the admin credential. 
But the user A does not have the User B's credential, so user A dismiss the UAC.



### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

The PowerToy will fail to launch due to the lack of admin access, and the system continue to load

### 閴 Actual Behavior

The PowerToy launches the UAC again, and the login process became a deadloop. User has to reimage the whole computer.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: aDisplayName

Title_Description:
AOT not working with OneNote 2016 ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.56.2

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Always on Top

### Steps to reproduce

Restart PowerToys as administrator
Open OneNote (2016) Window
Enable AOT using ctrl-alt-T
Click to change focus to full-screen Excel (AOT functions as expected)
Click to change focus to OneNote 
Click to change focus to full-screen Excel (OneNote disappears behind Excel)
Alt-tab to change focus to OneNote 2016 (AOT outline still present)
Enable AOT using ctrl-alt-T (AOT outline remains present)
Disable AOT using ctrl-alt-T (AOT outline disappears)


It appears that selecting focus to the OneNote Window is disabling AOT without moving the border lines. This may be because OneNote has an internal AOT function which is not playing nicely with PowerToys.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

AOT to function properly after multiple focus changes.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

AOT is disabled when refocusing OneNote, but the user interface is not updated to reflect this.

### Other Software

OneNote 2016
Excel 2019
PowerToys v0.56.2
Creator: aredman

Installer: internal MSI file is not signed ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.57.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Installer

### Steps to reproduce

It helps to have security software that only runs allowed software (including software signed with certain certificates), such as CarbonBlack.  You can see the lack of signing without that, though it won't cause any functional issues.

1. Install an old version of PowerToys
2. Update it from within PowerToys
3. If you have said security software, see that it blocks execution of C:\ProgramData\Package Cache\{45E073FD-1ED7-4787-B445-2980175F449A}v0.57.0\PowerToysSetup-0.57.0-x64.msi and the update fails to install
4. If you don't have said security software, inspect that .msi file and see that it is unsigned (no Digital Signatures tab in the Properties window)

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

The .msi file would be signed by Microsoft

### 閴 Actual Behavior

The .msi file is not signed (by Microsoft or anyone else)

Title_Description:
Installation problems with 57.0 ### Microsoft PowerToys version

"0.57.0"

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

General

### Steps to reproduce

Ran the update by clicking the message in the Windows 10 System Notifications.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Clean installation of update

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Installation started and status window displayed.
Message about installation of Windows Desktop Runtime started.
After about 2 minutes the desktop disappeared and was replaced by a totally blue screen.
Installation continued and completed. 
Powertoys control panel and Release Notes windows were displayed.
Desktop still displayed blue screen - assumption (later shown correct) was that Explorer had crashed and not restarted.
Other tasks were still running and could be displayed using Alt-Tab.

Tried restarting Explorer via Task Manager.
Windows desktop displayed briefly then disappeared. This cycle repeated ad infinitum as Explorer continually crasheds and restarted.
Used Ctrl-Alt-Delete to log off and log on again.
Normal behaviour restored.

Reviewed Event Log and observerd multiple errors related to this instalaltion.
Copy of event log is attached.

Title_Description:
Certain Inkscape SVG files do not preview ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.57.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

SVG Preview

### Steps to reproduce

SVG files created with Inkscape 1.1 and newer show text instead of the image in the preview pane. Files created with older versions of Inkscape preview just fine. I have included 3 small example svg files in the attached zip.

The trigger is the existence of the **xmlns:svg** line, and it's position, in the \<svg\> section.

### example1.svg
Created with Inkscape v1.0, displays fine in the preview pane.

### example2.svg
This is the same image but created with Inkscape v1.1. When comparing the \<svg\> (and other) sections, notice that the items within those sections are in the reverse order of those created with Inkscape v1.0, which shouldn't matter based on what I read in the SVG specifications.

For this file, the preview pane shows 2 lines of text instead of the image:

Example 2 SVG
Example 2
	
### example3.svg
By swapping 2 lines in the \<svg\> section, the image will display in the preview pane.

I used Notepad++ to edit the file and swapped the order of these 2 lines:

   xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"

to:

   xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"

and the image displayed in the preview pane immediately after saving the file. Swap the lines back, save the file, and the text will display again instead of the image.

The image will also display if I simply delete **xmlns:svg** line from the \<svg\> section:

Starting with the 0.57.0 version, I worked backwards and installed the previous versions of PowerToys and found that this behavior was introduced in PowerToys v0.33.1. In v0.31.2, all three files show the image in the preview pane.

[examples.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/8415763/examples.zip)



### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

All Inkscape SVG files to display in the preview pane.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Text was displayed in the preview pane.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: ronsqae

Title_Description:
Power Rename - Endless Explorer.exe crash loop when renaming User Directory <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

# Environment

```
**Windows build number:** Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18363.720]
**PowerToys version:** Version v0.15.2
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): Power-Rename
```

# Steps to reproduce
1. go to C:/Users
2. Rightclick user profile folder.
3. Power Rename.

# Expected behavior

Either a rename, if I am allowed, OR, a message to say that I'm unable.

Note that explorer.exe hides the rename option, which is why I tried to power rename it.

# Actual behavior

Explorer.exe will hang for a short time, but then will get into a crash-kill-boot loop and the computer has to have a hard restart.

# Screenshots
Can't be bothered to do it again but you should be able to understand what a crashing explorer looks like. :)

Title_Description:
Win10 issue with FancyZones and screen scaling ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.57.2

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones, FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

Set screen scaling to >100%
Launch layout editor
Examine the screen size in the "monitor" preview at the top of the editor's front page.  This monitor displays the scaled resolution and not the true resolution  e.g.  2552x1112 instead of 3440x1440
Editing Zones then become constrained by this scaled resolution and not the true resolution
Applying Zones then limit each zone to use only the scaled resolution 2552 instead of the true resolution 3440, which leads to zones not consuming all of the available screen space.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Previously and expectedly the editor would show the true monitor resolution and edited zones would consume all of the monitors screen area regardless of what the scaling was set to.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Editor shows the scaled resolution and zones only consume that amount of the monitor, not consuming the full monitor space.  Setting scaling back to 100%, editing the zones, and then resetting the scaling allows for a workaround.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: syserss

Title_Description:
Unhandled .NET Exception 0x800705B4 SVG Thumbnail Timeout ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.58.0

### Running as admin

No

### Area(s) with issue?

SVG Thumbnail

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a folder that contains an SVG in File Explorer
2. Copy and Paste the SVG file
3. Create a shortcut (`.lnk`) to either of the files
4. Shortcut does not get a thumbnail, progress bar loads forever, timeout exception window eventually appears

Clicking continue resumes COM Surrogate's CPU usage, which does not cease even with cancelling the progress bar, refreshing or closing the File Explorer window, or force restarting Windows Explorer. If you kill COM Surrogate and restart Windows Explorer, then the thumbnail will generate just fine on re-opening the folder with no continued CPU usage.

While creating a shortcut is a reliable way of reproducing this issue, I am also getting this fairly frequently when simply saving a file from Inkscape into a folder open in File Explorer, which has been very frustrating.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Thumbnail is generated in at most a couple of seconds

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Thumbnail is not immediately generated, File Explorer progress bar appears, .NET Exception window opens somewhere with 0x800705B4, COM continues to use CPU indefinitely:
```
System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x800705B4): This operation returned because the timeout period expired. (0x800705B4)
   at System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.ThrowExceptionForHR(Int32 errorCode)
   at Microsoft.Web.WebView2.Core.CoreWebView2Environment.CreateCoreWebView2ControllerAsync(IntPtr ParentWindow)
   at Microsoft.Web.WebView2.WinForms.WebView2.InitCoreWebView2Async(CoreWebView2Environment environment)
   at Microsoft.PowerToys.ThumbnailHandler.Svg.SvgThumbnailProvider.<>c__DisplayClass10_0.<<GetThumbnail>b__1>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location ---
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.<>c.<ThrowAsync>b__128_0(Object state)
```

### Other Software

Inkscape 1.1.2

Nothing of note in the File Explorer logs, just initialising after each computer restart. Windows 10 21H2 (19044.1645).
Creator: Road-hog123

0.59.0 (issue was also present in 0.57.2, maybe also earlier)

### Running as admin

### Area(s) with issue?

Always on Top

### Steps to reproduce

0. Configure Always On Top with "Show a border around the pinned window"
1. Open a window (e.g. Windows Explorer)
2. Set it to stay Always On Top (via keyboard shortcut)
3. Move it to another desktop
  - press Win+Tab
  - (click "New Desktop" if only one exists)
  - drag the window to another desktop
4. Don't switch to that desktop immediately, stay at the current one (click on old desktop)

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

The border only appears around the window an nowhere else.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

- The border stays on the old desktop, even though the window was moved to the new desktop.
- It disappears after switching to another desktop and back.
- The window correctly has the border after moving to another monitor.

Title_Description:
PT Run, does not always select the top/first item in the list of results. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.59.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

PowerToys Run

### Steps to reproduce

It looks like this (the SECOND item in the list is pre-selected):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4396667/173718557-b587a2bf-f19f-471e-bb16-2389f75b2ecb.png)

And it should look like this (the first item in the list should be pre-selected):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4396667/173718603-362644e3-c1dd-41d1-9d2f-775cab0d9ba2.png)

What seems to cause this is if you.
1) have the "Web Search" set to include in global results
2) have something that matches the text BUT also is higher up by Score because you have clicked it before. 

I did some digging in the code and it can be "hacked" to work by updating PowerLauncher.ViewModel.MainViewModel.Query(). If update method adding this:

```
Task.Run(() =>
{
	Thread.Sleep(150);                    
	Results.Sort();
	Results.SelectFirstResult();
}).Wait();
```

it will "fix" this but it does not seem like the correct way and is an arbitrary delay that just happens to work for my machine.




### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

The first item in the result set is ALWAY pre-selected so that if you hit ENTER, that's the one that is activated. 

### 閴 Actual Behavior

In my case, "Web Search" result is pre-selected even though it's not the first in the list. This causes you to activate it instead of the first item in the list if you just hit enter.

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: jefflord

Title_Description:
PowerRename Window Size (does not resize) ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.60

### Running as admin

- [ ] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

PowerRename

### Steps to reproduce

Details
Use as normal with right-click context menu.
Using a super ultra wide monitor (5120x1440) and Display Scaling is 100%.

Explanation
Older versions (when it still looked like the classic Win32 UI), allowed you to resize the Windows and it remembered the size.
Now it defaults back to the original Windows Size Preset.

This is especially problematic on large resolutions as it always takes up a large portion of the screen on open (resolution 3826x1016 !!

![20220708_145556 - PowerToys PowerRename88](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40537324/178006370-04a4920a-cd50-47a9-8369-397d8cb592cd.jpg)
)

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Resized Window should persist like older versions.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Does not persist as described in Steps to reproduce.

You can check on lower resolutions and the same thing happens, takes up majority of the screen.

To exaggerate the problem, temporarily change your display scale to 100% if you're currently running above (which is common on small displays such as 13-15inch with 2 or 4k displays resolutions).

### Other Software

_No response_
Creator: infuriatedcodex

Title_Description: Handle invalid zones correctly Based on [this discussion](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/pull/1955#discussion_r404848591), we should handle invalid zones as soon as we detect them, i.e. during `MakeZone` call by throwing an exception or returning a nullptr. We also need to have tests which check if we don't accept invalid values. We must ensure we can't [create invalid zones in practice](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/pull/1955#discussion_r405400714) and update corresponding tests accordingly.

Title_Description:
[FancyZones Editor]: All custom layouts' dimensions changed on remote computer when opening editor over RDP. ### Microsoft PowerToys version

0.61.1

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

FancyZones Editor

### Steps to reproduce

Computer A is local. Computer B is remote. I am connecting to computer B using RDP. The RDP session is a maximized window, and not full-screen. Both computers are attached to monitors with a native resolution of 3840x1600. Computer B is also attached to a second monitor with a resolution of 1200x1920.
All dimensions stored in %LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\PowerToys\FancyZones\custom-layouts.json are changed when you open the FancyZones Editor on Computer B.

I have attached three versions of custom-layouts.json for reference:

1. **custom-layouts - original.json.txt** is the version of the file before opening the FancyZones Editor. 
2. **custom-layouts - expected.json.txt** is an example of the expected file contents when adding a layout with the FancyZones Editor via RDP. 
3. **custom-layouts - actual.json.txt** is the actual file after adding a layout with the FancyZones Editor via RDP.

The **Portrait** layout is used by the 1200x1920 monitor.
The **Horizontal UltraWide 12:5** layout is used by the 3840x1600 monitor.
The **RDP - Horizontal UltraWide 12:5** layout is used by the RDP connection window.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

1. Opening FancyZones Editor on Computer B does not automatically change explicit dimensions for all layouts relative to the current screen resolution in custom-layouts.json.
2. Adding a layout on Computer B over an RDP session does not automatically change explicit dimensions for existing layouts.
3. Editing a layout on Computer B over an RDP session does not automatically change explicit dimensions for existing layouts.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

1. Opening FancyZones Editor on Computer B automatically replaces dimensions for all layouts in custom-layouts.json.
2. Adding a layout on Computer B over an RDP session automatically changes dimensions for existing layouts.
3. Editing a layout on Computer B over an RDP session automatically changes dimensions for existing layouts.

### Other Software

N/A

### Suggestion
1. Provide two options for entering values for each zone's dimensions in FancyZones Editor: explicit (px) dimensions, and relative (%) dimensions. e.g. 1920px vs. 50%
2. Refresh Computer B's layouts' relative dimensions when:
a. an RDP connection is established; or
b. when a local user logs in/unlocks Computer B.
Creator: another-git-hub-user

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open Power Toys App
2. Launch Narrator.
3. Navigate to PowerToys Run Button present on the left side and activate it.
4. Now press activation shortcut keys to open PowerToys Run window.
5. PowerToys Run utility window will get open.
6. Focus will land on power launcher edit field.
7. Now enter any data say 'word', suggestions list will get appear.
8. Now navigate to suggestion list say 'Word'
9. Observe the issue.

**Note:**
Issue is repro with NVDA as well.

**Guidelines Reference:**
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/info-and-relationships

**Attachment:**
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79564581/188409629-8f72fabd-a21e-433a-9b72-b5b49ef6d21c.mp4


### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Narrator should announce the information about the Appended controls present at suggestion list item when focus is navigating to complete suggestion list.

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Narrator does not announce about the Appended controls present at suggestion list item when focus navigates to complete suggestion list item.

Quick Accent triggers Keyboard Manager Malfunction  ### Microsoft PowerToys version

v0.62.0

### Running as admin

- [X] Yes

### Area(s) with issue?

Keyboard Manager

### Steps to reproduce

1) Configure Keyboard Manager Shortcuts (Alt+[ to Win Left, Alt+] to Win Right)
2) Enable Quick Accent (default is disabled, when enabling leave the setting as default)
3) Confirm the Keyboard Manager Shortcuts works as expected (for the above setting, this trigger Windows alignment to left/right)
4) Press A + Space bar (at the same time) to trigger the Quick Accent feature with character a with multiple accent options (select any character)
5) Now, try to use the Keyboard Manager Shortcuts (Alt+[ or Alt+]), and you should confirm it is no longer working.
Only after rebooting the computer, the shortcuts works as expected, but again, if you trigger the Quick Accent, the error occurs.

Note 1: With previous version v0.61.1, Keyboard Manager Shortcuts works without issue. (Because Quick Accent does not exist).
Note 2: Somehow, I don't know exactly so I can not report details, but after the error reported above occurs, the " Bug Report" menu call displays the "Bug report.zip file has been created on your Desktop" dialog is show, but NO ZIP file is created.  

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected Behavior

Both features work as expected.
Keyboard Manager Shortcuts working as configured (in the bug report case, the Windows alignment to left/right)
Quick Accent working as designed

### 閴 Actual Behavior

Keyboard Manager Shortcuts no longer working just like before Quick Accent is called.

Title_Description:
[KBM Bug Bash] Keyboard Manager keys stop responding + remapping keys and shortcuts windows crash and close # Steps to reproduce

It happened once, not able to reproduce it on a second trial for now, below are the steps that lead to the initial bug:
- Open the `Remap a key` window (that had an existing remapping (A to Z)
- Open the `Redefine a shortcut` window 
- Delete the key remap first (A to Z) in the `Remap Keyboard`
- Switch to the `Edit Shortcuts` and try to remap a shortcut typing Ctrl + A ( attempt for Ctrl+A to Ctrl+Z) [ _A was typed as Z.. expected from a remapped key perspective, but counter intuitive since I am expecting the physical behavior of keys while setting up remapping_]
- Switch back to the `Remap Keyboard` window, applying changes to delete the existing remap
- Switch back to `Edit Shortcuts` window and manipulating the same previous remapping attempts
[_Can't remember the exact number of times I switched back and forth between the 2 windows_]

# Expected behavior
Smooth behavior between the 2 windows, taking applied actions synchronously.

# Actual behavior
- Both `Remap Keyboard` and `Edit Shortcuts` windows close spontaneously
- Leaving the Keyboard Manager non actionable : the buttons are clickable but non responsive, no window is being opened until PowerToys restarted (even if a tab is changed to a different PowerToys Setting).

Title_Description:
FancyZones editor doesn't fit in 768px (height) resolutions <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

# Environment

```
Windows build number: 10.0.18362.295
PowerToys version: 0.11.0
![FancyZones768px](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9450935/64443564-0f750380-d087-11e9-8cfb-708710bc9e2f.png)

PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): FancyZones
```

# Steps to reproduce

On a screen resolution of 768px (height), open the FanzyZones zone editor.

# Expected behavior

Zone editor window should allow all form elements to be visible, either initially or upon resize.

# Actual behavior

The Cancel and Apply buttons are barely visible, and users must guess which sliver of a button is for what purpose.  The window cannot be maximized nor resized.  The only way to get a glimpse of the button labels is to drag the very bottom of the title bar upward, thus nudging the entire window up just enough to temporarily see the buttons.  Upon release, the window snaps back to the original position, hiding most of the buttons again

# Screenshots

![FancyZones768px](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9450935/64443723-6b3f8c80-d087-11e9-9955-40df9637e63d.png)

Title_Description:
"wrong" key is shown for FancyZones shortcut 0.18

Have a look at this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23729465/82385097-96a9b200-9a31-11ea-9625-a17b392a58fe.png)

The following is given a code-formatting, cause the Markdown syntax of Github interferes with the semantics.
(feel free to edit this properly, though)

the table I reference:
http://cherrytree.at/misc/vk.htm
```
I use the "Windows International Keyboard"-layout.
So when I press the key to the left of 1, I get ` 
When I shift+press it, I get ~
Looking up 192 in this table gets me to ~ again.
http://cherrytree.at/misc/vk.htm

Expected behaviour:
Instead of making me look up something in a 
table of arcane knowledge from the dawn of days, 
it would simply instead show:
`Win + ``

because that is exactly what it is.

Might be some corner case with UWP not knowing 
how to handle the fact that ` is a dead key in 
the Windows International Keyboard. 
This appears to be an issue with all dead keys,
 I have tried so far.

[quick explanation about dead keys for English-only 
speakers who might never have needed them: 

A dead key is a key that doesn't immediately appear. 
For example " is a dead key on Win-international. 
I have to press the key itself and then space to print it. 
This allows me to press " and then a, o, u to get 鐩, 鏋, 鐪. Tilde ~ is 
a dead key mainly used to form this special character 甯.]
```
Creator: DavidGretzschel

Title_Description:
[KBM]: Remap of PgUp/Home, PgDown/End doesn't work with SHIFT # Environment

```
Windows build number: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18363.836]
PowerToys version: 0.18.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): Keyboard Manager
```

Unfortunately, I have a less than desirable keyboard layout on my laptop that I've struggled with for 8 or so years. I tried the standard Windows Keyboard mapper utility years ago, but it did not do what I wanted. Fast forward to yesterday, and I installed the PowerToys and discovered I can map the keys I want. And it seemingly worked! Yay. Except...then it didn't.

My keyboard requires me to use <kbd>Fn+PgUp</kbd> for <kbd>Home</kbd> and <kbd>Fn+PgDn</kbd> for <kbd>End</kbd>. Being a programmer, that is extremely non-ideal. 

# Steps to reproduce

So, I implemented the following mappings:

* <kbd>PgUp</kbd> -> <kbd>Home</kbd>
* <kbd>Home</kbd> -> <kbd>PgUp</kbd>
* <kbd>PgDn</kbd> -> <kbd>End</kbd>
* <kbd>End</kbd> -> <kbd>PgDn</kbd>

As I indicated, these keys are remapped as desired. However, all was not working as I had hoped. 

# Actual behavior

However, while coding in Visual Studio, I went to highlight a line of code using <kbd>Shift+Home</kbd>. But the line was not highlighted. The cursor simply moved to the beginning of the line. The same was true for <kbd>Shift+End</kbd>, the cursor was simply moved to the end of the line. (I just tried in the web browser in this here issue editor, and the same thing happens when using those key combinations.)

Additionally, the same behavior is true of <kbd>Shift+PgUp</kbd> and <kbd>Shift+PgDn</kbd>: the cursor moves to the beginning/end of a page of text but does not cause a selection to occur.

And again I remind you, that in order to access the physical <kbd>Home</kbd> and <kbd>End</kbd> keys on my laptop keyboard requires the use of the <kbd>Fn</kbd> key—perhaps that has something to do with "losing" the <kbd>Shift</kbd> modifier.

Surprisingly, <kbd>Ctrl+Home</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl+End</kbd> result in the correct behavior. And, <kbd>Ctrl+PgUp</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl+PgDn</kbd> work, too. (And again, two of these key combos also require the use of the <kbd>Fn</kbd> key—so it's odd that there doesn't seem to be a problem with <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> but there is with <kbd>Shift</kbd>.)

# Expected behavior

I expect that using the <kbd>Shift</kbd> modifier with any remapped keys would work as with any other keyboard key modifier.
Creator: fourpastmidnight

Title_Description:
Windows get the wrong size when there are 2-screen with different DPIs involved # Environment
Windows 1909 18363.356
Surface Book 2 (screen is at 200% scale)
Connected to a Dell U3818DW monitor (at 125% scale).
The geometry of the screens in Settings is this (38" Dell monitor is above the SB2 screen):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54721784/64819792-ed3a2480-d563-11e9-8e4c-50552a2c3349.png)

Configuration is a custom one, where the Dell monitor is divided as follows: the left 2/3 of the screen as an area and the right 1/3 is divided into 2. The SB2 screen is not divided (entire screen is an area).

```
Windows build number: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18363.356]
PowerToys version: 0.11.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): FancyZones
```

# Steps to reproduce

1. Drag a window from the left (2/3 of the screen) to the bottom area in the right 1/3.
2. The Window gets resized, but since it temporarily occupies mostly the SB2 screen (where the DPI is higher and the scale is higher) the window then gets shrunk and needs to be moved again to the same area to resize correctly.
3. Move the window a big again (same target zone) to get the intended size.

# Expected behavior
No need to move a second time, i.e. the window gets resized after the effect of switching to a different DPI screen (different scale in settings) takes place.

# Actual behavior
The window gets resized and only then the effect of switching to a different screen scale takes place, leaving the window too small (in my setup).


# Screenshots

Before moving the window:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54721784/64820014-5f126e00-d564-11e9-8de8-33732c606223.png)

While moving the window (when it's still mostly on the Dell screen with lower scale %):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54721784/64820723-d694cd00-d565-11e9-9d56-7cd5ec265981.png)

While moving the window (it gets bigger as it occupies mostly the SB2 screen with higher scale %):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54721784/64820633-a51c0180-d565-11e9-8897-6921e21683e3.png)

After moving the window the first time (and having it in the process grow temporarily as part of the move, then resized, then shrink due to the lower scale %):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54721784/64820109-9719b100-d564-11e9-8f69-1d7bf376b1ca.png)

A second move solves this, as the window then gets only resized without temporarily having a bigger scale):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54721784/64820167-adc00800-d564-11e9-95b9-81d0f9524029.png)
Creator: amnonig

Title_Description:
[Run, tracker] calculator (mage nuget) having calculation issues # Environment

```
PowerToys version: 0.18.1
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): Power Run
```

# Example 1 : digits after the decimal point

Example: type "123 * 4.56"
Result = 560,8800000000001

Probably an an issue with the signing of the number, since the total amount of digits is 16, or converting binary to decimal. When using one negative number, the result = -560,8800000000001.

![Power Run - calculator - new digits](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65828559/82834089-5da18f80-9ec0-11ea-965a-c652bc973240.png)

# Example 2 : no operator

Example: type "123 456"
Result = 56088

No operator is used here. I know that multliplication may be implied between numbers and constants, or between numbers and (other things in) brackets, but not between numbers only. Also, spaces may sometimes be used in big numbers as thousands separators.

Suggestion: Spaces between only numbers should be ignored (like treated as thousands separators). Unless somebody else has a better idea?

![Power Run - calculator - no operator](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65828559/82834102-62feda00-9ec0-11ea-8188-ba4f2f7f6ba5.png)
Creator: Jay-o-Way

Title_Description:
Fancy Zones settings not retained across virtual desktops <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

# Environment

```
Windows build number: [run "ver" at a command prompt] 10.0.18362.356 x64
PowerToys version: 0.11.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): Fancy Zones
```

# Steps to reproduce

1. Configure Fancy Zones settings on Desktop 1 and configure as per your wish
2. Open any app and drag it to the Fancy Zone, it works
3. Press Win+Tab and create a new Desktop
4. Open an app in new Desktop
5. Try to drag it to a Fancy Zone, your configured setting is not retained

<!-- A description of how to trigger this bug. -->

# Expected behavior

<!-- A description of what you're expecting, possibly containing screenshots or reference material. -->
The zones layout should be replicated on each desktop I create. So dragging a window with shift enabled should give me the same behavior on each desktop regardless of whether it is the primary one or not. Quite Similar to #332 

# Actual behavior

<!-- What's actually happening? -->
The zones only works on the primary desktop. With another desktop, it can only maximize the windows. I don't know if this is by design but from my point of view, it makes sense to replicate the zones layout on each desktop or add an option to do so.

# Workaround

Open Fancy Zones setting on the new desktop and close it. The layout selected on the primary desktop is retained here too.
Creator: Sparker0i

Title_Description:
Installation of v0.18.0 began a UAC prompt every boot <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

WIndows 10 Pro N / 1909

```
Windows build number: 18363.836
PowerToys version: v0.18.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): N/A
```

# Steps to reproduce

Have v0.17.0 installed, configured to "Always run as administrator" and "Run at startup", and running. -> Download and run "PowerToysSetup-0.18.0-x64.msi". -> Click next until it's done updating. ->right-click/settings on corner icon -> turn off the new stuff that's not FancyZones and wasn't previously existing for the update process to carry over -> restart the computer -> log-in -> right away, UAC prompt for starting PowerToys

# Expected behavior

Previously, PowerToys was starting itself as admin without triggering UAC

# Actual behavior

My hypothesis: the PowerToys folder in Task Scheduler being empty after the update suggests that the update process Uninstalled the previous version, and took the scheduled task with it that circumvents the UAC prompt for running as admin, and the new installer never puts it back, despite my settings warranting it being there (to avoid the annoyance of a UAC prompt every boot).

What I did to fix it was: go to settings, turn off "Always run as admin" -> turn off "Run at startup" -> exit settings -> exit program thru corner icon right-click -> start program thru start menu -> back to settings -> restart as admin  -> enable "Always run as admin" -> enable "run at startup" -> refresh Task Scheduler and wha-la, PowerToys has now replaced the Task that circumvents a UAC prompt, that it removed while updating, but failed to regenerate it upon install of both v0.18.0 and v0.18.1, despite it succeeding in bringing over my settings that schedule the task in the first place.

Seems like you just need to either A) add a step to the end of the installer that checks for "always run as admin" && "run at startup" being enabled in my settings it saves/copies from my previous install, and then regenerate the task. B) check for the task before running the uninstall and, if it was there, regenerate it anytime after the Uninstaller removes it.

I assume the installer for the new version is just running the Uninstaller for the old one, so depending on your level of concern for "maximum lean-ness", you could also go deep for option C) that would build a flag into the Uninstall that would skip removing the existing task, if the Updater/Installer tells it to do so, after checking whether the task already exists (because, you know, maybe someone loves UAC prompts and removed it themselves and they'd be annoyed if you put it back after I removed it on purpose). I assume you know why just having the Uninstaller check would be no good (because it wouldn't know on it's own whether it's being run to forever-uninstall, or just as a means to clean reinstall).

I haven't looked at your code to know anything about what you have going on, so this is all just conjecture and my relishing in the opportunity to talk programming logistics. Certainly, I'm not trying to insult your intelligence, if any of the suggestions where immediately obvious. Or, if a all-around better option is, I'd be interested to know what you end up doing (if this is even something you'll remember to fix by the time it gets priority).

Alright, 閴.

P.S. Thanks for making the program I've wanted for as far back as I can remember (FancyZones)!

P.P.S. I'm not going to make a seperate thread for this but, you should know, if you don't already: before v0.18.0, dragging a window and then right-clicking to bring up the zone pop-up used to be smooooth as butter and happen instantly. After v0.18.0 though, the moment I press right-click while dragging, my entire beefy machine absolutely sh*ts the bed for like 2 whole seconds while PowerToys summons the zone overlays. That'd be cool if you ever fixed that.

Also, please let me assign a key/combo while dragging/dropping on the zone overlays that will "cycle thru the layers" of zones I have set up that are overlapping each other where my mouse pointer is, so i can drop my window on the zone that is underneath the zone that's on top, which is the only one FancyZones will highlight as a drop target.
Creator: chrickso

Title_Description:
Autostart affects other minimized (to Tray) autostarted apps and blocks whole desktop <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

# Environment

```
Windows build number: Version 10.0.18363.836
PowerToys version: v0.18.2
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): FancyZones & General
```

# Steps to reproduce

Install for example Telegram Desktop (official). Activate the following options in Telegram:

![telegram settings](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14014947/83995944-1e148200-a95b-11ea-9b8e-2202ffe207be.png)

This is also true, for other application with similar options (for example Mattermost Desktop Client).

Activate Autostart for PowerToys:

![settings1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14014947/83995954-2a98da80-a95b-11ea-83c0-32e5e643d6f7.png)

Use the following FancyZone settings:

![settings2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14014947/83995961-32f11580-a95b-11ea-8efd-2052b47b4fbd.png)

I think the problematic setting is "Move newly created windows to their last known zone". Disabling this setting worked for this issue. But I'd like to use this function (I have some applications that are not storing their last window position by itself).

# Expected behavior

FancyZones should not affect hidden Windows or block any desktop interaction. The windows might be resized to fit to their zones, when they are initially visible (opening the other apps first time)

# Actual behavior

FancyZones seems to want to resize these non-visible windows. With Telegram only a shadow of the window is left behind at system start:

![start problems](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14014947/83996288-08538c80-a95c-11ea-883a-ebc9436ec9b4.png)

In addition, the screen area where the application would normally be displayed is now blocked. This means that you can no longer right-click on the desktop or drag a selection rectangle. If another application is moved into the area, all mouse actions are blocked as well.

This also applies to other apps like Mattermost Desktop (this application does not have a shadow). So you can see the problem better with Telegram.
Creator: Huseriato

Faulting application path: C:\Program Files\PowerToys\modules\FancyZonesEditor.exe
Faulting module path: C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\d3d9.dll
Report Id: xxxx
```

Occasionally the white overlay will flash very quickly but no windows will open

# Workaround

In  RTSS, add a custom rule to disable the OSD specifically for FancyZones.exe

**or**

disable the OSD altogether



### Note to PowerToys maintainers:

I created this issue with the intent to document the interaction between the 2 applications for people who are experiencing FancyZones crashes. If this is deemed out of scope and closed I take no issue with that.
Creator: cakekindel

Title_Description:
[setup] installation with MS Configuration Manager fails # Environment

```
Windows build number: 10.0.18363.900
PowerToys version: 0.19.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): installer
```

# Steps to reproduce

using MS Config Manager to install as application model, elevated, allow user interaction. msiexec /i PowerToysSetup-0.19.0-x64.msi /qb!
CfgMgr runs the installer in system context.

# Expected behavior

Should just show the msiexec progress bar with no cancel button

# Actual behavior

shows msiexec progress, but stops and shows popup "unable to create scheduled task...". when you click ok to dismiss the scheduiled task popup, it says 1 second remaining, but hangs for at least 20 seconds, then exits w/ error 0 - app is listed in Apps control panel, but not in start menu or systray. CfgMgr throws an error because the product code isn't detected in the registry uninstall key after msiexec is done.


# troubleshooting

added CREATESCHEDULEDTASK=0 property to command line - this eliminates the popup about scheduled task, but still doesn't fully install (exit 0, not in start or tray, CfgMgr doesn't see the product code in registry)
running manually as an admin user allows the installation to complete normally, even without using the CREATESCHEDULEDTASK property.  

But I must ask - why use a scheduled task? Wouldn't it be easier to just put the launcher in the RUN key of the registry? Seems a tool like this is intended to always be running so putting itself in the run key during install would be expected behavior. If you want to give users a choice, then put it in HKCU run instead of HKLM.
Creator: Gibson99

Title_Description:
PowerToys breaks GreenShot screenshotting software + workaround I notice that when PowerToys is running, and I use GreenShot to take a screenshot, it only allows me to screenshot one of the "zones" on my screen. I have a 3 monitor setup. It makes a small window of the left monitor show up in the left side of my middle monitor. I've attached a photo of my monitor when the bug happens.

![PowerToys_Breaks_Greenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6284996/67150664-886f9980-f288-11e9-83e8-1f4cf595ed36.jpg)

This is super annoying, because in order to use GreenShot I would need to close PowerToys, then take the screenshot, then open PowerToys again. 

I made a workaround in AutoHotKey, which closes PowerToys, sends the print screen command to GreenShot and allows me to select a region, then 5 seconds later opens PowerToys again.

The workaround AutoHotKey Script:
PrintScreen::
Run, PowerShell.exe -noexit -Command "Stop-Process -Name "PowerToys" -Force",, hide
Send {PrintScreen}
Sleep, 5000
Run, C:\Program Files\PowerToys\PowerToys.exe
Return

Hope this bug report, and workaround is helpful to someone!!
Creator: DigitalStaff

Title_Description:
UI Contrast Related Accessibility Issues of PowerToys Run ## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

Run Windows Accessibility insights on PowerToys Run.
Use the Color Contrast Analyser of Accessibility insights to detect the contrast ratio.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result
There should not be any contrast related accessibility issues.

### 閴 Actual result
These are the contrast related accessibility issues - 

1. The Subtitle contrast ratio is 3.052:1. However, regular text requires a ratio of atleast 4.5:1.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89061455-9410e600-d319-11ea-8a4b-17d06641c42a.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89061465-983d0380-d319-11ea-823f-4017cf61ac7b.png)

2. The above issue is present in the dark theme as well. The ratio is 3.019:1 in the dark theme for the subtitle, whereas it is required to be atleast 4.5:1.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89061569-c9b5cf00-d319-11ea-8e7c-be25b1d3ab22.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89061573-cd495600-d319-11ea-976b-376ce7fd8118.png)

3. When we tab through the buttons and put the mouse pointer as well over them (that is, when the tab is setting focus on that button and then we hover the mouse pointer over the same item), the contrast ratio in the light theme is 2.948:1, whereas it is expected to be 3:1 for graphical objects.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89061730-0da8d400-d31a-11ea-80ef-b51ba588ff73.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89061737-11d4f180-d31a-11ea-8010-f2c3ca19d119.png)
The contrast is above the threshold when we either tab only or use the mouse pointer only, but not when we use both to point to the same item.

We don't see the above issue with the dark theme.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89061757-231dfe00-d31a-11ea-904c-2849dd433d86.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89061766-2618ee80-d31a-11ea-8613-844cbf7f5d1c.png)
Creator: alekhyareddy28

Title_Description:
SVG rendering lacks scaling so they become can become blurry  <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

## 閳 Computer information

- Windows build number: 2004 (19041.388)
- PowerToys version: 0.20.0
- PowerToy module: File explorer preview

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. Open a explorer on a folder containing SVGs
2. SVGs should small width & width specified in their source (less than 50)
3. Change explorer view to large icons 

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

SVGs thumbnails are show correctly scaled to icon size.  
As SVG can be scaled to any output display size, the SVG canvas should be rescaled prior to display

Note. Removing the width & height attributes but specifying a viewBox resolves the issue, so the module should ignore width & height if a viewBox is present

### 閴 Actual result

SVGs are extremely blurry

Title_Description:
Installer gets stuck on "Installing dotnet..." <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

## 閳 Computer information

- Windows build number: 18363.959
- PowerToys version: 0.20.0
- PowerToy module:

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. In Action Center, click the Update button on the new update available notification from v0.19.2 to upgrade to 0.20.0
2. OR Download release 0.20.0 from GitHub and install directly

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

v0.20.0 is installed

### 閴 Actual result

1. Installation gets stuck on "Installing dotnet..."

### Detailed actual result

1. Notification informs me that the previous version (0.19.2) has been uninstalled.
2. Notification informs me "Installing dotnet..." with a progress percentage.
3. Progress percentage moves very slowly - after approx. half an hour is was only up to 50%. (I have a 200mbps fibre connection - broadband speed is not the issue). No way to cancel it as there's no installer dialog, just a notification in Action Center. (Terrible UI for an installation.)
4. Left it over night: next morning it's stuck on 99%.
5. Killed the update process from Task Manager.
6. Rebooted PC.
7. Manually installed .NET Core 3.1 Desktop Runtime from the link in the repo README. (Downloaded and installed in less than a minute.)
8. Downloaded PowerToysSetup-0.20.0-x64.exe from the Releases page and ran it.
9. Notification shows "Installing dotnet..." at 50% and progresses very slowly again (approx. 1% per minute)

## 棣冩懖 Screenshots

![Action Center screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/446635/89122043-08838a80-d4bc-11ea-96a8-7b6593da882b.png)
Creator: markwhitaker

Title_Description:
Grey flash after transitions between virtual desktops # Environment
```
Windows build number: 10.0.17763.805
PowerToys version: 0.11.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): FancyZones
```

# Steps to reproduce
## Prerequisites:
- Have at least 2 virtual desktops
- Start at the first virtual desktop
- Enable the FancyZones setting **Flash zones when the active FancyZones layout changes**
- Optional: Disable the **Animate windows when minimizing and maximizing** option in the Windows 10 **Performance Options**. This makes the unexpected flash more noticeable.
## Reproduction steps:
1. Press CTRL+WIN+Right arrow

# Expected behavior
Don't flash after the transition to another virtual desktop. Only flash when the active FancyZones layout changes.

# Actual behavior
- **Animate windows** enabled: (2 random scenarios)
1. While the animation to another virtual desktop is running a grey overlay scrolls into view. The grey overlay disappears after the virtual desktop animation is completed. 
2. Or a light grey flash appears after the transition to another virtual desktop.
- **Animate windows** disabled: After the virtual desktop animation is completed a light grey flash appears as if the active layout changed.

# Screenshots
Without virtual desktop animation enabled:
![PowerToys - FancyZones - Virtual Desktops flash bug - Without windows animations](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31220528/67432947-88a0c980-f5e7-11e9-861e-1345a5b6595c.gif)

With virtual desktop animation enabled:
![PowerToys - FancyZones - Virtual Desktops flash bug - With windows animations](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31220528/67432961-8f2f4100-f5e7-11e9-8695-27ca9bfb4177.gif)
Creator: WesselKroos

Title_Description:
[Image Resizer] filename format parameter description misplaced ## 閳 Computer information

- Windows build number: 20180.1000
- PowerToys version: 0.20.0
- PowerToy module: Image Resizer

## 棣冩憫 Detailed reproduction steps

1. Set the output format to [ %1_%6w鑴%5h ] which means **Original filename _ Actual width w 鑴 Actual height h**.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36418285/89136936-9c129500-d568-11ea-851f-4b94aa9557f5.png)
2. Resize pic.jpg (1920w鑴1080h) with [ Custom Fit 123鑴456 Pixel ].
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36418285/89136124-aaf74880-d564-11ea-9089-61ca4c424ba0.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36418285/89136147-bf3b4580-d564-11ea-9347-8c00723f8bac.png)
3. Then we got the... **pic_69w鑴123h.jpg**, but the resized pic is 123w鑴69h.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36418285/89137042-1e02be00-d569-11ea-9b93-45d3d0a00b8a.png)
4. So our format actually is **Original filename _ Actual _height_ w 鑴 Actual _width_ h**.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

pic_123w鑴69h.jpg

### 閴 Actual result

pic_69w鑴123h.jpg

### 棣冩敡 Fixing

%5 - Actual height --> Actual width
%6 - Actual width --> Actual height

They may just misplaced, exchanging the text can fix it.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36418285/89137593-370c6e80-d56b-11ea-8255-2034c661dafa.png)
Creator: ZetaSp

Title_Description:
KeyBoard Manager - Accessibility Issues - Tabbing related Issues ## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)
Run Windows Accessibility insights on KBM windows and KBM settings page.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result
- The user must be able to tab through the all components that a user can interact with.
- When the user tabs through a component, there must be a visual change that is noticable.

### 閴 Actual result
- This is the order of the tabs:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89352348-ba5fba00-d668-11ea-8e00-c84c4bc70987.png)

### Couple of issues - 
* Items 1 and 3 are not elements that the user can interact with, hence they should not be components that we tab through.
* Items 1 and 3 also consume two extra tabs, so to get from Item 3 to 4 (or Item 1 to 2), we have to press Tab three times.

### Additional Observations (where KBM acts as expected):
* Tabbing works as expected in the remap key and remap shortcut windows.
* KBM also ensures that the focused element (while tabbing) is visually different/highlighted.

## Feedback needed:
Currently there is a trap while tabbing in the following window.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/89353916-50e1aa80-d66c-11ea-9259-b38aaebb85f7.png)

The buttons OK, Cancel can never be accessed by tab. However, as we need to capture the keyboard input for this window, is the approach of using a long press of Enter and Esc the most accessible way?
Creator: alekhyareddy28

Title_Description:
FZ scaling bug in multi monitor scenario Originally reported by @brenca

# Steps to reproduce
Primary monitor at 125% or any other scaling that is not 100%
Second monitor on the left of the primary monitor.
Open FZ editor on second monitor and select the `Columns` layout.

# Expected behavior
The three columns should fit the monitor.

# Actual behavior
The columns are shifted to the right and cover part of the primary monitor.
If the second monitor is also scaling at 125% the layout is shifted to the left.

# Screenshots
More details here: https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/pull/520
Creator: enricogior

Title_Description:
"At next launch" sometimes starts installer while still running ## 閳 Computer information

- Windows build number: 2004 (19041.338)
- PowerToys version: v 0.20.0 (and others)
- PowerToy module: the auto-updater

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. Click "at next launch" when the toaster for a new version appears with the options for further actions.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

Dismissal of the toaster and update at next launch.

### 閴 Actual result

Some times the installer starts instead of deferring the update until next launch. It doesn't seem to happen the "first" time for a version, but on one of the later times the toaster is (re)shown. I haven't been able to find a more precise pattern, and at first I though I just clicked wrong somehow, but now it has happened several times with a few different versions so I starting to think this is a bug.

At least no harm is done since the installer needs to ask for admin privileges to uninstall the currently running version so simply denying it will prevent this from causing "damage".

## 棣冩懖 Screenshots

N/A
Creator: scientica

Title_Description:
FancyZones - Layout Editor - Accessibility bugs ## 閳 Computer information

- Windows build number: 2004 / 19041.421
- PowerToys version: v0.20.1
- PowerToy module: FancyZones
- NVDA version: 2020.02

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

* Install the [NVDA](https://www.nvaccess.org/download/) screen reader
* Recommended: open its "speech viewer" tool to see a log of what it announces
* Open the FanzyZones layout editor
* Attempt to create a custom layout, switch to it, and switch back to a standard layout using only a keyboard

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

* A user with limited vision (ie, can make out big shapes but uses a screen reader for text) and/or mobility (ie, cannot use a mouse) should be able to use FancyZones

### 閴 Actual result

Specific issues:


- All windows/dialogs:
  - [x] Keyboard focus ring indicator is difficult to see on blue buttons
  - [x] All windows are missing window titles (it閳ユ獨 just announced as 閳ユ凡indow閳 in NVDA, both when opening and when alt-tabbing)
  - [ ] No support for Windows high contrast mode (the only differences are the + and - buttons in the templates tab gain a light blue focus state background and all edit controls have invisible text, white text on a white background) **NOTE: we'll do this after porting to .NET Core** -> https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/8160
- In 閳ユ窅hoose your layout for this desktop閳:
  - [x] 閳ユ翻emplates閳/閳ユ怀ustom閳 tab controls are not present in tab order (can閳ユ獩 use tab key to focus them)
  - [x] The control displaying the different layouts a user can choose from is represented in tab order, but the individual layouts are not, and there doesn閳ユ獩 seem to be any way to 閳ユ竼nter閳 the layout-chooser control. This means that a keyboard user cannot select a layout.
  - In 閳ユ翻emplates閳 tab:
    - [x] ~閳ユ藩how space around zones閳 checkbox does not respond to enter key (should toggle it, same as space)~ <- it responds to spacebar, this is how it is supposed to work
    - [x] 閳ユ藩pace around zones閳 label does not get announced when the edit control it labels receives focus
    - [x] The + and - buttons for the number of zones are labeled 閳ユ笡lus button閳 and 閳ユ笗inus button閳; they should use labels more closely representing their actual function
  - In 閳ユ窅ustom閳 tab:
    - [x] The delete button for individual layouts is reachable in tab order, but is only announced as 閳ユ競utton閳, without saying 閳ユ竸elete閳 or the name of the layout
- In 閳ユ窅ustom layout creator閳:
  - [x] The name edit control is not programmatically connected to its 閳ユ笜ame閳 label, so it doesn閳ユ獩 get announced as being for the 閳ユ笜ame閳
  - [x] The escape key does not dismiss the dialog, like it does for the 閳ユ窅hoose your layout for this desktop閳 dialog
  - [ ] After adding a zone, no way to keyboard navigate to new zone閳ユ獨 UI (ie, no way to delete it with keyboard only) -> https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/8161
- In 閳ユ窅ustom table layout creator閳:
  - [x] The name edit control is not programmatically connected to its 閳ユ笜ame閳 label, so it doesn閳ユ獩 get announced as being for the 閳ユ笜ame閳
  - [x] The escape key does not dismiss the dialog, like it does for the 閳ユ窅hoose your layout for this desktop閳 dialog
  - [x] The 閳ユ穾dd new zone閳 button has no label and is only announced as 閳ユ競utton閳
  - [ ] No way to move keyboard focus to the zones or their dividers -> https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/8162
Creator: dbjorge

Title_Description:
FancyZones in combination with Sticky Keys <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

## 閳 Computer information

- Windows build number: 18363.900
- PowerToys version: v0.20.1
- PowerToy module: FancyZones

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

Important to note that because I'm disabled I always use windows in combination with Sticky Keys.

After updating to Powertoys 0.20.01 version from v0.18.2 and after rebooting, I noticed that the normal behavior of clicking the shift key (again, using Sticky Keys) and dragging a window doesn't show the configured zones in the normal highlight colour. Dragging the window doesn't "stick" to any (non-visible) zone.

Please note that the same problem happens in v0.19 thus v0.19 doesn't work correctly either!

After reinstalling v0.18.2 everything works as expected.
Creator: Heirwegh

All items are read.

Title_Description:

**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.

1. Open Settings - Image Resizer
2. Try setting a value with decimals in it
3. 閳

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

I know decimals are impossible for pixels, but when using centimeters or inches (which isn't even decimal)...?

Title_Description:
FZ flashes zones when trying to type symbols or numbers # Environment

Windows build number: 10.0.18362.449
PowerToys version: v0.12.0
PowerToy module: FancyZones

# Issue Details

At the moment, I do not have a precise set of steps to trigger this bug; however, I can describe it and the two scenarios where it has occurred so far.

The issue first popped up while I was typing in a website's text box in Chrome. I attempted to type a left parenthesis `(`, which did not insert anything into the text box, but instead caused FancyZones to flash the outlines for my current zones. The `)` key did the same, and typing other characters did not eliminate the issue. I was only able to do so by dragging the Chrome window (which had been maximized) into its restored-down state.

The issue occurred again while I was typing in a reply box from a "Messages via Your Phone" notification in the Action Center - attempting to enter an exclamation mark `!` caused my zone borders to flash. (When you receive a text message, the Your Phone app creates a notification containing the message and a text box in which to type a response. This is the box I was using.) This issue worked in much the same way, but closing and re-opening the Action Center did not resolve it. On a hunch, I dragged Chrome (which was still open) into its restored-down state as before, and the issue disappeared.

It is worth noting that, on my keyboard (a standard US English laptop keyboard with a number pad), the parentheses `(` and `)`, as well as the exclamation mark `!` are located on the number keys, requiring `Shift` to be pressed in order to type them. While the issue was present, typing letters worked normally.
Creator: LRitzdorf

### 閴 Actual result

Title_Description:
[Settings] Accessibility issues related to XAML Islands (RadioButtons control + null BoundingRectangle) <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 
- PowerToy Utility:
- Running PowerToys as Admin:
- Windows build number: [run "winver"]

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

* Run PowerToys Settings page.
* Run the Microsoft Accessibility insights app on PT Settings.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

_What is the expected result of the above steps?_
* No automated tests fail.
* We should tab into the selected radio button (in a group of radio buttons) and be able to navigate to the other radio buttons using the arrow keys. However, this does not happen when we add the radio buttons control in xaml islands.

### 閴 Actual result

_What is the actual result of the above steps?_
* It always tabs into the first radio button irrespective of which radio button in the group is selected. 
* Navigation using arrow keys does not work, hence making the other radio buttons inaccessible using the keyboard.

Automated tests fail because of having the DesktopWindowXAMLSource Pane.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28739210/90567600-3e349e80-e15f-11ea-9854-b0169784fe1d.png)

## 棣冩懖 Screenshots
More information can be found in this issue which fixes the tab related issue by using a stackpanel instead of a radiobuttons control - https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/5726

#### Corresponding issue in the microsoft-ui-xaml repo - microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml#3156 (regarding the XYNavigation)
#### Corresponding narrator issue in the microsoft-ui-xaml repo - https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/issues/3183 (regarding the narrator not reading the heading)
Creator: alekhyareddy28

Title_Description:
[FancyZones] Cannot use separate layouts on multi-monitor  <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

# Environment

```
Windows build number: [Version 10.0.18362.387]
PowerToys version: 0.12.0.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): FancyZones
```

# Steps to reproduce

I have 2 custom layouts. One for the left monitor, one for the right.
1. I move the mouse to the left monitor and press [WIN] ~
2. I choose Custom, and the left layout option.
![left](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5576809/67908977-bf706580-fb3a-11e9-9107-9550b2b43c24.png)

3. I click Apply
4. I move the mouse to the right monitor and press [WIN] ~
5. I choose Custom, and the right layout option.
![right](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5576809/67908920-87692280-fb3a-11e9-9d02-3317015c5d4a.png)

I click Apply.
The right monitor layout is applied to all monitors. I have tried also just moving the settings window before hitting apply but that doesn't work either.

I can also use the main settings window, drag to the monitor, change the layout, and the same behavior happens, both monitors are updated.

# Expected behavior

Expected to be able to have a separate layout on different monitors.

# Actual behavior

Identical layout applied to all monitors.

# Screenshots

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

Title_Description:
[FancyZones] crash after changing color in the Settings. This commit https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/commit/953ab958d596de8ffcb0b6c5b4b910cf2b972ce4#diff-e5cf909b6a10ee543197f047def424d9 may be causing the change in saving the colors from RGB to ARGB format.

FancyZones crashes when parsing the ARGB format: https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/blob/master/src/modules/fancyzones/lib/FancyZones.cpp#L136-L167

Two fixes are needed:
 - improve the FZ color parsing so that it won't crash if the color is saved in a different format
 - revert the commit that changed the color format to ARGB

Title_Description:
[FancyZones] Span across monitors setting does not function 
## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: v0.21.1
- PowerToy Utility: FancyZones
- Running PowerToys as Admin: No
- Windows build number: Windows 10 Version 2004: 19041.450

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. Check the **Allow zones to span across monitors** checkbox
2. Configure a zone which uses multiple monitors via the **Launch zones editor** and Apply
3. Attempt to snap window to zones, or use Shift key to highlight zones while dragging

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

- A window should snap to a zone
- Zone highlighting ought to be functional
- The **Allow zones to span across monitors** setting should persist even when closing settings
- If there are errors "Activating" the zones, these should be raised to the user

### 閴 Actual result

- A window will not snap to a zone when the **Allow zones to span across monitors** is configured
- Window zone highlighting is also not functional
- When FancyZones settings is closed and re-opened, the **Allow zones to span across monitors** checkbox is unchecked
- When **Allow zones to span across monitors** is toggled to checked, then unchecked, zone highlighting and snapping functions, though obviously not with the multi-monitor zones

### 棣冩憫 Other Notes

- There is a difference in framerate/refresh rate between the two monitors--could that be an issue?
- System is a SurfaceBook 2 in a Surface Dock which drives a 2560 x 1440 monitor at **60 fps** and a 2560 x 1440 monitor at **30 fps**
  - The fps cannot be made the same as far as I can tell. Likely a hardware limitation.
- Display is an LG 49 ultra-wide ( 5120 x 1440)

Installer removes version 0.20.1.0 and installs 0.21.1.0.

Title_Description:
PowerToys stopping installation of calibre e-reader software <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 0.20.1 for me, can't comment on others who have reported this on the calibre forum
- PowerToy Utility: NA
- Running PowerToys as Admin: Not me, can't comment on others who have reported this on the calibre forum
- Windows build number: For me Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18363.1016], can't comment on others who have reported this on the calibre forum

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

When I tried to install calibre 64 bit v4.23 https://calibre-ebook.com/ the installation failed part way through.  When I checked the calibre forum, there were reports of this happening when PowerToys was running, e.g. see https://www.mobileread.com/forums/showthread.php?p=4022916#post4022916 so I shutdown PowerToys and tried installing calibre again.  This time it installed correctly.

I don't see any reports of this here, so I'm reporting it.

PowerToys may have also caused the error shown here when I was installing LibreOffice v7.0.1, though as this error wasn't fatal, I haven't run an installation with PowerToys shutdown:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20718946/92369864-e5906a00-f13c-11ea-9f83-bfece65fcac4.png)




### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

calibre installs correctly.

### 閴 Actual result

calibre installation encounters an error and calibre fails to install.

- PowerToy Utility: FancyZones
- Running PowerToys as Admin: No
- Windows build number: [Version 19041.508]

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

Try edit a templated layout, then save and use it.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

The zone numbers in the layout editor should correspond to the actually applied layout.

### 閴 Actual result

The zone numbers in the layout editor don't correspond to the actually applied layout, making it impossible to match landscape with portrait layouts.

The reason I want to use an edited templated layout is because fully custom layouts don't adapt to autohide taskbar.

Title_Description:
PowerToys Keyboard Manager silent crash when using locally & in RDP session <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 0.21.1
- PowerToy Utility: Keyboard Manager
- Running PowerToys as Admin: Yes
- Windows build number: [run "winver"] 19041.508

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. Start PowerToys locally.
2. Enable Keyboard Manager with several remaps.
3. RDP into remote computer.
4. Start PowerToys on remote computer.
5. Enable Keyboard Manager on remote computer with same remaps as local computer.
6. Attempt to use one of the remapped keys in the RDP session.
7. Attempt to use one of the remapped keys on the local computer.

(also commented on another issue here: https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/4756#issuecomment-696803699)

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

_What is the expected result of the above steps?_
Remapped keys function normally in both RDP session and on local computer.

### 閴 Actual result

_What is the actual result of the above steps?_
Remapped keys function normally in RDP session, and local PowerToys silently crashes as soon as the remapped key is used in RDP session. Disabling Keyboard Manager on local PC prior to using remapped keys in RDP session prevents the crash.
Windows Event Viewer log of crash:
```

PTRun crashed after turning on options `Clear the previous query on launch` and `Disable drive detection warning for the indexer plugin`.
After the crash, I was unable to open the PTRun settings tab, it crashed the Settings app.

- PowerToys version: 0.21.2

- Windows build number: 19041.508

2. Pressed shortcut to open PTRun.

Since there was a `System.IO.IOException: The directory is not empty`, I've deleted that directory manually. After that PTRun works well without any exceptions with both options on.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

PTRun opens.

### 閴 Actual result

PTRun opens with an error message. When tried to open PTRun settings, Settings app crashed too.
This behavior remained unchanged after PowerToys restart.
