Title_Description:
[KBM] Accessibility: Remapping keys is very hard to do with a screen reader <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 0.21.1
- PowerToy Utility: Keyboard Manager
- Running PowerToys as Admin: No
- Windows build number: [run "winver"] Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.508)

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. With the [NVDA](https://www.nvaccess.org/) screen reader loaded, press **Windows + B** to move to the notification area.
2. Press **Enter** on the "Notification Chevron" button, to expand the hidden icons.
3. Using the **Left Arrow**, find the PowerToys icon, and press the **Applications key**.
4. Press the **Down Arrow** key until you hear "Settings, and press **Enter**.
5. In the settings window, press **Tab** until you hear "general one of nine".
6. Press **Down Arrow** until you hear "Keyboard manager."
7. Press **Tab** until you hear "remap a key." Press **Enter** on that button.
8. You'll hear "remap a key," but nothing else. Focus doesn't land on anything.
9. If you press Tab, you'll find an "OK" button, a "Cancel" button, and an unlabeled button. If you press the unlabeled button, you'll find dropdown boxes, called "combo boxes" in screen reader jargon, for choosing keys, and an edit field, but there is no way to check which boxes are for the source key, and which are for the target key. I can review the screen with Object Navigation in NVDA, see the [user guide](https://www.nvaccess.org/files/nvda/documentation/userGuide.html?) for info on that, but it is still not clear which control I should be using to remap the keys.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

The expected result is that a blind person who is proficient with technology would be able to use a screen reader to get just as much out of computers, including more advanced usage, as sighted users. I expected that, with Microsoft's push into greater accessibility, that PowerToys would have just as much accessibility focus that much of the rest of Windows does. The expected result is that I can remap a keyboard command, like Windows + F10 to play/pause, and use the rest of the PowerToys just as successfully.

### 閴 Actual result

The screen reader cannot read the button to, apparently, open the configuration dialog. I suspect that there is also a list, empty for now, of keys that have been remapped, that the screen reader misses entirely. When remapping keys, the screen reader does not speak which fields are for choosing a key, and which are for remapping the chosen key.

## 棣冩懖 Screenshots

No screenshots are necessary.
Creator: devinprater

Title_Description:
Hang in runner startup due to new DPI awareness code I was testing out some changes and noticed that the power toys runner was hung.  There was a long wait in m_dpiUnawareThread.submit call in fancyzones.cpp.  I ended up commenting out the DPIAware::EnableDPIAwarenessForThisProcess(); line in runner main.cpp to get around this issue.

Might be relevant - I have 3 monitors with 100% dpi.
Creator: chrdavis

Title_Description:
[Screen reader: Settings>General]: Screen reader does not notifying the user after activating close/open navigation button. [Power Toy Settings>General>left pane]

User Impact:
It will impact all the screen reader users if the screen reader is not notifying the users on activating open/close navigation button.

Test Environment:
OS Version: 20226.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

Reproe-Steps:
1. Open Power Toys Settings App. Turn on narrator.
2. Navigate to 'Open Navigation' button present in left pane and activate it and verify the issue. 

Actual Result:
Screen reader does not notifying the user after activating close/open navigation button.
Note:
Same issue is repro with NVDA(2020.2)

Expected Result:
Screen reader should announce the confirmation information after activating open/close navigation button. So that screen reader users will get notified.

MAS Reference:
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={b19c05bd-d82f-4d6d-a8e5-7081bf5c2dba}

Title_Description:
[Screen Readers - Power Toys - Power Rename]: In scan/item mode, screen reader focus navigation is not proper in both forward and backward direction. [Power Toys Utility-Power Rename]

User Impact:
If any application does not expose information and mechanisms necessary to track focus, text insertion point, and selection attributes (e.g. whether text has been selected for copy/paste) of user interface components,  it would be difficult for the platforms that provide Accessibility APIs, and would in turn affect the screen reader dependent users to determine the focus.

Test Environment:
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

Reproe-Steps:
1. Launch Narrator.
2. Open Power Toys Settings App.
2. Open File explorer and select multiple files and open context menu and select Power rename. 'Power Rename' dialog will open.
3. Make narrator in scan mode using caps+Space keys.
4. Navigate in the 'Power Rename' dialog in scan/item mode in both forward and backward direction.
5. Observe the issue.

Note:
This issue is repro throughout the app.

Actual Result:
'In scan/item mode, screen reader focus navigation is not proper in both forward and backward direction.

Expected Result:
'In scan/item mode, screen reader focus navigation should be logical and proper in both forward and backward direction.

MAS Reference:
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7Bb24201d1-2276-4471-8183-e1e5353031ad%7D&cid=b0e66f0d-86ce-4b30-8979-3dbd3189fda1

[42_MAS4.2.10_Scan_item_mode_navigation_not_proper.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/5328470/42_MAS4.2.10_Scan_item_mode_navigation_not_proper.zip)

Title_Description:
[Screen reader - Settings>Remap key>Delete button]: Screen reader is not announcing any confirmation after deleting the remapped key. [Power Toys Settings- Keyboard Manager> Remap Key]

**User Experience:**
This will impact the Screen reader users as they will not able to know whether the remapped key is deleted or not.

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Pre-Requisite:**
Add remapped key.

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open Power Toys Settings App. Turn ON narrator.
2. Navigate to Keyboard Manager list item present in left pane and activate it.
3. Navigate to Remap a key button present in right pane and activate it.
4. Remap Key window will open.
5. Navigate to 'Delete' button present in window and activate it and verify the issue. 

**Actual Result:**
"Screen reader is not announcing any confirmation after deleting the remapped key.

**Note:**
This issue is repro throughout the application in deleting any key, deleting custom created template, deleting shortcut.

Same issue is repro with NVDA(2020.2)"

**Expected Result:**
Screen reader should announce the confirmation after deleting the remapped key. It should announce like 'Key Deleted/ Remapped key Deleted'.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7bb19c05bd-d82f-4d6d-a8e5-7081bf5c2dba%7d

[Screen reader - Settings>Image Resizer]: Screen reader is not conveying any information about the tooltip of info icon. [Power Toys Settings- Image Resizer > File Format]

**User Experience:**
This will impact the screen reader users as they will not get the information about the data present in tooltip of info icon.

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Launch Narrator.
2. Open Power Toy Settings App.
3. Navigate to 'Image Resizer' menu item present t left pane and activate it. 'Image Resizer' will open in right side.
4. Navigate to 'Filename Format' edit field present inside Image size section and  Observe the issue.

**Actual Result:**
Screen reader is not conveying any information about the tooltip of info icon when Narrator focus moves to 'File name format' control.

**Note:**
This issue is repro throughout the app.
In scan mode also the screen reader focus is not landing on the information icon and File Format label."

**Expected Result:**
Screen reader should convey information about the tooltip of info icon OR focus should separately land on the info icon. 

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={a12f3779-bdf1-40c2-bbcc-0e314ea94858}

App Name: Power Toy Preview

Screen Reader: Narrator

3. Navigate to 'Image Resizer' and activate it. Image Resizer will open.
4. Navigate the Image Resizer with tab key and verify the issue.

**Actual Result:**
Keyboard focus is landing on the 'Settings' hidden control in Image Resizer pane and on activating it 'Settings' dialog will open.

**Note:**
Users are not able to activate Settings link with mouse.

**Expected Result:**
'Settings' link should be visible on screen and on activating it 'Settings' dialog should open.

Title_Description:
[Visual Requirements- Fancy Zones-Launch Zones-Create New Custom]: Luminosity ratio of 'Name' edit field boundary with its white background is 1.6:1 which is less than 3:1. [Fancy Zones-Launch Zones -Utility-Create New Custom]

User Impact:
Low-vision users will be affected here as they will not be able to see the 'Name' edit field boundary as its luminosity ratio is less than required and hence users will not be able to assess it as a edit field.

Test Environment:
OS Version: 20226.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Tools Used: Accessibility Insights for Windows Color Contrast Analyzer.

Reproe-Steps:
1. Open Power Toys App
2. Navigate to Fancy Zone Button and activate it.
3. Navigate to Launch Zones Editor and activate it.
4. Navigate to Custom tab in  Choose your layout for this Desktop dialog and select it.
5. Navigate to Create new custom item and select it 
6. Navigate to Edit Selected layout element and activate it.
7. Navigate to 'Name' edit field boundary and verify its luminosity ratio.

Actual Result:
Luminosity ratio of 'Name' edit field boundary with its white background is 1.6:1 which is less than 3:1.

NOTE
1: Same issue reproes for the 'Cancel' button's background boundary (Grey color boundary with white background luminosity ratio is less than 3:1)
2.Issue reproes throughout the application 

Expected Result:
Luminosity ratio of 'Name' edit field boundary with its white background should be greater than or equal to 3:1 for a clear visibility of the edit field control

MAS Reference:
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B6CA3BF14-2635-434A-832C-28DD9A18B9FC%7D&file=MAS%201.4.11%20%E2%80%93%20Non-text%20Contrast.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=df981

30a-86a8-4d09-b429-cff8a475e262

Title_Description:
[Keyboard Navigation - Power Toys - Settings]:  Heading levels are not defined in the app. [Power Toys Settings]

User Experience:
If the content is not operated through a keyboard or keyboard interface, it would not be operable by people with no vision, Some people with hand tremors find using a mouse very difficult , as well as by people who must use alternate keyboards or input devices that act as keyboard emulators. Individuals with low vision would also find it difficult to control it from the keyboard.

Test Environment:
"OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator"

Repro-steps:
"1. Launch Narrator.
2. Launch Power Toys settings App.
3. Make narrator in Scan mode(Caps lock +Space key -to enable).
4. Navigate in the app in Heading mode using 'H' key.
5. Observe the issue."


Actual Result:
"Heading are not defined in the app.
NOTE:
This issuue repro throughout the application for all the pop-up, pane, dialog etc."

Expected Result:
Headings should be defined in the app.

MAS Reference:
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B0cf80872-800d-4643-90cf-0c1c3d3e6260%7D&cid=84783472-d416-47b6-ae86-e1e12f5a839c

An element of the given ControlType support the Table pattern

Expected Result:
An element of the given ControlType must not support the Table pattern

Title_Description:
[Screen Readers - Power Toys - Image Resizer > Add Size]: Screen reader remains silent after activating  'Add Size' button. [Power Toys Settings-Image Resizer  > Add Size]

User Experience:
If there is no notification of events relevant to user interactions, changes in the component閳ユ獨 state(s), value, name, description, or boundary it would be difficult for the platforms that provide Accessibility APIs, and would in turn affect the screen reader dependent users to determine the information of any new page , new dialog box etc.  

Test Environment:
"OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator"

Repro-steps:
"1. Launch Narrator.
2. Open Power Toys Settings App.
3. Navigate to 'Image Resizer' list item and activate it. 'Image Resizer' settings will open in right pane.
4. Navigate to 'Add Size' button and activate it.
5. Observe the issue.
"

Actual Result:
"Screen reader does not announce anything after activating  'Add Size' button.

Note:
1. Same issue is repro on activating Remove button. Please refer the attachment, ""7_MAS4.2.12_No_confirmation_remove_button.wmv"".
2. This issue is repro with other screen reader i.e., NVDA and JAWS.
3. This issue is repro for every action happened successfully present throughout the app."

Expected Result:
Screen reader focus should move onto recently added configuration field and should annouce its information after activating  'Add Size' button.

Title_Description:
[Keyboard Navigation - Power Toys - Power ToysRun]: Tooltip defined for the appended controls present in the Suggestion list items are not accessible using keyboard. [Power Toys Utility-Power ToysRun]

User Impact:
If the content is not operated through a keyboard or keyboard interface, it would not be operable by people with no vision, Some people with hand tremors find using a mouse very difficult , as well as by people who must use alternate keyboards or input devices that act as keyboard emulators. Individuals with low vision would also find it difficult to control it from the keyboard.

Test Environment:
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

Reproe-Steps:
1. Open Power Toys Settings App.
2. Navigate to 'Power ToyRun' menu item and activate it.
3. Set the shortcut key for Power ToyRun say 'Ctrl+Shift+U'. 
4. Launch the Power ToyRun using shortcut key defined.
5. Enter any character say W. Suggestion list will appear.
6. Navigate to appended controls present in the Suggestion list items using keyboard.
7. Observe the issue.

Note:
This issue is repro throughout the app.

Actual Result:
Tooltip defined for the appended controls present in the Suggestion list items are not accessible using keyboard. They are accessible using mouse only.

Expected Result:
Tooltip defined for the appended controls present in the Suggestion list items should be accessible using both keyboard and mouse.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B8492c4eb-c179-40ae-8777-cd044ed725a2%7D&cid=8e9c5d8d-1753-43a8-a0eb-aff08efca479

"Label of 'Open Color Picker' edit field is not associated in Color Picker. Screen reader announce it as 'Set Shortcut Read only edit field  Alt'.

"

Title_Description:
[Visual Requirements - Power Toys - Fancy Zones > Launch Zone Editor]: Luminosity ratio of dark blue dotted focus indicator with light blue background on 'Apply' button is 2.0:1 which is less then 3:1. [Power Toys Utility-Launch Zones Editor]

User Impact:
If a minimum luminosity contrast ratio of 3:1 is not provided between foreground and its background, it would be difficult  people with moderately low vision to identify them. Good luminance contrast accommodates diverse color deficiencies and provides contrast that is independent of color perception. 

Test Environment:
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

1. Launch Color contrast analyzer tool.
2. Open Power Toys Settings App.
3. Navigate to 'Fancy Zones' menu item and activate it. 'Fancy Zone' pane will open.
4. Navigate to 'Launch Zone Editor' button and activate it. 'Choose your layout for this desktop' window will open.
5. Naviagte to 'Apply' button using tab key.
6. Verify the luminosity ratio of the focus indicator on Apply button using Color contrast analyzer tool.
7. Observe the issue.

Note:
Visual focus indicator is not properly visible on Apply button.
Same issue repro on Save and Apply Button in Custom Layout creator Dialog

Actual Result:
Luminosity ratio of dark blue dotted focus indicator with light blue background on 'Apply' button is 2.0:1 which is less then 3:1.

Expected Result:
Luminosity ratio of focus indicator on 'Apply' button should be minimum 3:1.

MAS Reference:
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B6CA3BF14-2635-434A-832C-28DD9A18B9FC%7D&file=MAS%201.4.11%20%E2%80%93%20Non-text%20Contrast.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=1bcf1a59-2f1a-43ef-a1d5-759ad277b11e

[58_MAS1.4.11_Luminsity_ratio_focus_indicator_fails.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/5329012/58_MAS1.4.11_Luminsity_ratio_focus_indicator_fails.zip)
Creator: Shubham786786

Title_Description:
[Screen Readers - Power Toys - Power Rename]: Screen reader do not convey the confirmation feedback after successfully activating Rename button. [Power Toys Utility - Power Rename]

**User Experience:**
If there is no notification of events relevant to user interactions, changes in the component閳ユ獨 state(s), value, name, description, or boundary it would be difficult for the platforms that provide Accessibility APIs, and would in turn affect the screen reader dependent users to determine the information of any new page , new dialog box etc. 

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Launch Narrator.
2. Open Power Toys Settings App.
2. Open File explorer and select multiple files and open context menu and select Power rename. 'Power Rename' dialog will open.
3. Make some changes like 'Enter character' in 'Search for edit box and and enter character in 'Replace' edit box.
4. Navigate to 'Rename' button and activate it.
5. Observe the issue.

**Actual Result:**
Screen reader do not convey the confirmation feedback after successfully activating Rename button.

**Note:**
This issue is repro with other screen reader(NVDA and JAWS)
This issue is repro throughout the app.

**Expected Result:**
Screen reader should convey the confirmation feedback after successfully activating Rename button like 'Renamed' so that user would get to know some action has been performed.

Title_Description:
[Programmatic Issue - Settings> Custom Layout Creator]: Name property of a focusable element is set as a null in code. [Power Toy Settings - Fancy Zones - Launch Zones Editor-Custom-Delete]

**User Experience:**
This will impact all the screen reader users if the name property of the control is not defined in code.

**Pre-Requisite:**
Accessibility Insights for Windows application should be installed in the system.

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open Power Toys Settings application.
2. Navigate to Fancy Zone present at the left side of the pane and activate it.
3. Navigate to 'Launch Zone Editor' present at the right side of the pane and activate it.
4. Navigate to Custom tab in  Choose your layout for this Desktop dialog and activate it.
5. Navigate to Edit selected layout and activate it. A custom layout Creator dialog will open.
6. Run K4D and verify the issue.

**Actual Result:**
Name property of a focusable element is set to null in 'Custom Layout Creator' dialog.

Note:
Same issue is repro in Choose your layout for this Desktop dialog for the Delete button.

**Expected Result:**
Name property of a focusable element should not be be null in 'Custom layout Creator' dialog. It should have appropriate name.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7b248054a6-5e68-4771-9e1e-242fb5025730%7d

Title_Description:
[Keyboard Navigation - Settings>Image Resizer>File Explorer Sizes tab]: Keyboard focus is incorrect after 'File' tab in Settings dialog. [Settings - Image Resizer - File Explorer(System)]

**User Experience:**
This will impact the keyboard users if keyboard focus is irrelevantly land on pane of the dialog.

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open File Explorer using Win+E key.
2. Navigate to any photo and press right click.
3. Navigate to 'Image Resizer' and activate it. Image Resizer will open.
4. Navigate to settings link and activate it. 
5. Navigate to File tab and activate it.
6. Navigate the pane using tab key and verify the issue.

**Actual Result:**
Keyboard focus is landing on the pane using tab key and on activating 'Enter' key the Settings dialog is getting closed.

Observation:
It should behave like Settings of Image Resizer in Power toy Settings.

**Expected Result:**
Keyboard focus should not land on the complete pane using tab key. On pressing tab key after File tab, the focus should jump to Sizes list. 
Sizes should be defined in list and users can navigate to list using up/down key. The edit field must be navigable using tab key.

**MAS Reference:**
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7b0de7fbe1-ad7e-48e5-bcbb-8d986691e2b9%7d

[35_Image Resizer_MAS2.4.3_Focus is landing on pane.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/5329226/35_Image.Resizer_MAS2.4.3_Focus.is.landing.on.pane.zip)
Creator: Chandresh1007

Title_Description:
[Keyboard Navigation - Power Toys - Fancy Zones > Launch Zone Editor]: 'Focus/Column/Rows/Grid/Power Grid' menu items present in the 'Choose your layout for this desktop' window are not accessible using keyboard. [Power Toys Utility-Launch Zones Editor]

**User Experience:**
If the content is not operated through a keyboard or keyboard interface, it would not be operable by people with no vision, Some people with hand tremors find using a mouse very difficult , as well as by people who must use alternate keyboards or input devices that act as keyboard emulators. Individuals with low vision would also find it difficult to control it from the keyboard.

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open Power Toys Settings App.
2. Navigate to 'Fancy Zones' menu item and activate it. 'Fancy Zone' pane will open.
3. Navigate to 'Launch Zone Editor' button and activate it. 'Choose your layout for this desktop' window will open.
4. 'Focus/Column/Rows/Grid/Power Grid' menu items using keyboard.
5. Observe the issue.

**Actual Result:**
'Focus/Column/Rows/Grid/Power Grid' menu items present in the 'Choose your layout for this desktop' window are not accessible using keyboard. They are accessible using mouse only.

**Expected Result:**
'Focus/Column/Rows/Grid/Power Grid' menu items present in the 'Choose your layout for this desktop' window should be accessible using both keyboard and mouse.

**Note:**
Same issue is repro under 'Custom' tab also.
Same issue is repro after activating Edit selected layout button

**MAS Reference:**
[https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B8492c4eb-c179-40ae-8777-cd044ed725a2%7D&cid=11dfb0db-05fd-431c-b94d-f2b97e7746c4](url)

[63_MAS2.1.1_Focus_column_list_item_not_accessible_keyboard.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/files/5329237/63_MAS2.1.1_Focus_column_list_item_not_accessible_keyboard.zip)
Creator: Ajesh-k

Title_Description:
[Screen Reader- Color Picker-Open color picker]: Label as 'Open Color Picker' is not descriptive for the edit field [Power Toys- Settings-Color Picker]

**User Experience:**
Visually challenged users will not be able to understand the functionality of the control if its label is not descriptive in nature.

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open Power Toys App
2. Navigate to 'Color Picker' button by tab and down arrow key and select it.
3. Turn on narrator by 'Ctrl+Win+Enter' keys.
4. Navigate to 'Open color Picker' edit field and observe the issue

**Actual Result:**
'Label as 'Open Color Picker' is not descriptive for the edit field. Here narrator announces as 'Set shortcut read-only edit field'


NOTE: Same issue reproes for 'Fancy Zones-Open zones editor' edit field, 'Image Resizer- File name ' and 'Power ToysRun-Open Power Toys run' edit field

Observation: Same issue reproes with NVDA 2020

**Expected Result:**
Label for the edit field should be descriptive in nature and should clearly define the functionality of the control.
Here narrator should announce as  'Open color Picker shortcut setting edit field'.

[https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={0cf80872-800d-4643-90cf-0c1c3d3e6260}](url)

"Color contrast ratio of the selected combo box is 1.4:1 which is less than 3:1.

Title_Description:
[Screen Readers - Power Toys - Fancy Zones > Launch Zone Editor]: Name should be defined descriptively for '+/-' buttons on 'Choose your layout for this desktop' window. [Power Toys Utility-Launch Zones Editor]

**User Experience:**
When standard controls from accessible technologies are not used and if the user interface elements are not used according to specification, Assistive Technologies (AT) will not be able to gather information about, activate(or set) and keep up to date on the status of user interface controls in the content.

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Launch Accessiblity Insights for Windows tool.
2. Open Power Toys Settings App.
3. Navigate to 'Fancy Zones' menu item and activate it. 'Fancy Zone' pane will open.
4. Navigate to 'Launch Zone Editor' button and activate it. 'Choose your layout for this desktop' window will open.
5. Verify the name defined for '+/-' buttons using Accessiblity Insights for Windows tool.
6. Observe the issue.


**Actual Result:**
'Name is not defined descriptively for '+/-' buttons on 'Choose your layout for this desktop' window. It is defined as '+' and '-' respectively.

**Expected Result:**
'Name should be defined descriptively  for '+/-' buttons. So that Assistive technologies could read the proper information about the control.

**MAS Reference:**
[https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B248054a6-5e68-4771-9e1e-242fb5025730%7D&cid=83b38665-7047-4d84-9951-52467e48e407](url)

[Functional - Power Toys - Power Rename]: After entering value to 'Search For' edit box leaving 'Replace' edit box blank 'Rename' column getting updated as per 'Search for' edit box in the Preview table. [Power Toys Utility-Power Rename]

User Experience:
It will impact the user if without giving any input the result will appear in the table.

Test Environment:
"OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator"

Repro-steps:
1. Open File explorer and select multiple files and open context menu and select Power rename. 'Power Rename' dialog will open.   2. Enter any character input to 'Search for' edit box and leave the Replace edit box blank intentionally.   
3. Verify the updated result in "rename' column of the Preview table.   
4. Observe the issue.

Actual Result:
After entering value to 'Search For' edit box leaving 'Replace' edit box blank 'Rename' column getting updated as per 'Search for' edit box in the Preview table.

Expected Result:
After entering value to 'Search For' edit box leaving 'Replace' edit box blank 'Rename' column should not be getting updated as per 'Search for' edit box in the Preview table.

Title_Description:
[Screen Reader- Fancy Zones-Launch Zones-Create New Custom]: 'Name' label is not assocaited with its edit field on the 'Custom layout Creator' dialog [Fancy Zones-Launch Zones -Utility-Create New Custom ]

**User Experience:**
Visually challenged users will not be able to understand the functionality of the control if its label is not associated with the edit field

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open Power Toys App
2. Navigate to Fancy Zone Button and activate it.
3. Navigate to Launch Zones Editor and activate it.
4. Navigate to Custom tab in  Choose your layout for this Desktop dialog and select it.
5. Navigate to Create new custom item and selet it 
6. Navigate to Edit Selected layout element and activate it.
7. Turn on Narrator by 'Ctrl+Win+Enter' keys.
8. Navigate to 'Name' edit field and observe the issue

**Actual Result:**
'Name' label is not assocaited with its edit field and hence narrator only announces the placholder infromation. 
It announces as 'Edit Custom Layout 1'

**Expected Result:**
'Name' label should be assocaited with its edit field and thus narrator should announce as 'Name edit field Custom layout 1'.

NOTE: 
Same issue reproes for the 'Space around zones' checkbox label and 'Distance to highlight zones' checkbox
This issue is repro for all the edit boxes/combo boxes present throughout the app.

**MAS Reference:**
[https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={4b95a70d-258c-474a-820e-5c8b79d5c0bf}](url)

Title_Description:
[Visual Requirements- Fancy Zones-Launch Zones-Create New Custom]: Luminosity ratio of 'Custom' tab item text with its white background is 1.72:1 which is less than 4.5:1 [Fancy Zones-Launch Zones -Utility-Create New Custom]

**User Experience:**
Low-vision users will be affected here as they will not be able to see the control and hence will not be able perform the desired action if the luminosity ratio of the control's text element is less than required.

**Test Environment:**
OS Version: 20221.1000
App Name: Power Toy Preview
App Version: v0.23.0
Screen Reader: Narrator

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open Power Toys App

Title_Description:
[Settings] revisit the warning message UX This is currently in master and not release yet.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3206696/96463957-8f2c4600-1227-11eb-94f2-a90e15e6d0be.png)

Steps to reproduce: on a local build (not installed) start PT as user.
This may also happen with an installed version if for some reason the settings require to toggle ON/OFF the module status.

The problems with the current warning are:
 - the title should not start with "Failed" since it seems like a fatal error that may have prevented PT to successfully start
 - the terminology `register/unregister` is a dev implementation detail, to communicate the problem to the user we should use the terms `turn on/turn off`
 - there is no way to dismiss this dialog so that it will not pop up the next time PT will restart, if the user is not ad admin, is pointless to keep showing this message
 - we should consider replacing the dialog with a toast notification
Creator: enricogior

Title_Description:
[Localization] Image Resizer Sizes may appear unlocalized Image Resizer has default Image Size names `Small`, `Medium`, `Large` and `Phone`, which are localized. However, since these Image Sizes are stored in the settings.json file, if the sizes already exist in the profile in one language, the same language will be retrieved irrespective of the current OS language. 
For example in the scenario below a user has used Image Resizer for the first time while their OS language was English, and later they switch to French. Since the profile names have already saved the English names to JSON, opening Settings or Image Resizer in French will show the English names for the profile.
![existing imageresizer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32061677/96633330-d2d98b00-12cd-11eb-9843-22dc942062e6.png)

After deleting the settings file ImageResizer/settings.json, if the user opens Image Resizer directly from the context menu, the correct localized names will be loaded. If you open Settings first however, it will still load the English strings. This is because the default sizes in Settings are hardcoded strings.
Screenshot from French after deleting settings.json and opening Resize Pictures before Settings.
![after reset image resizer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32061677/96633326-d1a85e00-12cd-11eb-8b21-0afc305c0fc8.png)
Creator: arjunbalgovind

Title_Description:
Using FancyZones hotkey with off-screen window causes PowerToys to crash ## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 0.23.2
- PowerToy Utility: FancyZones
- Running PowerToys as Admin: Yes
- Windows build number: 18363.1139

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. Run on system with multiple monitors.
2. Create zones on multiple monitors.
3. Open multiple applications, place on various monitors and minimize all apps. (Minimizing apps my not be required.)
4. Sleep computer.
5. Disconnect from external monitors.
6. Reconnect to external monitors.
7. Wake computer.
8. Restore apps one at a time.
9. If an app does not get restored to a visible monitor then use FancyZones hotkey to move it between zones. 
10. If it is off-screen then I use Alt-Space M to start a window move then use the cursor keys and mouse to get it back on screen. Then I can use FancyZones hotkeys without crashes.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

The app should be moved back into a visible area into one of the zones on my monitors.

### 閴 Actual result

PowerToys crashes with this event:

Faulting application name: PowerToys.exe, version: 0.23.2.0, time stamp: 0x5f7e08e8
Faulting module name: fancyzones.dll, version: 0.23.2.0, time stamp: 0x5f7e0348
Exception code: 0xc000041d
Fault offset: 0x0000000000017aa9
Faulting process id: 0x7114
Faulting application start time: 0x01d6a62aee6a980f
Faulting application path: C:\Program Files\PowerToys\PowerToys.exe
Faulting module path: C:\Program Files\PowerToys\modules\FancyZones\fancyzones.dll
Report Id: 493d61e2-8ea5-4f39-b936-f750f3b8f0d7
Faulting package full name: 
Faulting package-relative application ID: 

There is also a crash log but the stated files do not exist on my systems so I can't send them to the secure email. This is the content of the event for the report, I don't think this contains anything sensitive:

Fault bucket 1560973228008127610, type 4
Event Name: APPCRASH
Response: Not available
Cab Id: 0

Problem signature:
P1: PowerToys.exe
P2: 0.23.2.0
P3: 5f7e08e8
P4: fancyzones.dll
P5: 0.23.2.0
P6: 5f7e0348
P7: c0000005
P8: 0000000000017aa9
P9: 
P10: 

Analysis symbol: 
Rechecking for solution: 0
Report Id: 4cca6a1f-7cf7-4a9a-b230-7452ef9e4a99
Report Status: 268435456
Hashed bucket: ecb000dfa3c48e0ee5a9b0e16751bc7a
Cab Guid: 0

This is very consistent on my machine. I sleep my laptop every night, take it home, wake it the next morning and find that some of my apps will restore off-screen. I've found that I have to move them back on screen before using FancyZones features to manipulate them or PowerToys will crash. I believe the same thing happens if I start an app and it gets placed off-screen initially.

Title_Description:
[FZ Editor] hold-shift for rotating splitter pretends to be broken, but is just very fiddly # Environment

```
Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18362.476]
0.13
Fancyzones
```

# Steps to reproduce

Press win+`
Edit selected layout (which one does not matter)
hold shift

# Expected behavior

splitter orientation changes

# Actual behavior

splitter orientation does not change

# Reason
The "custom table layout creator" is still in focus and eats the key-input.

# Confusion it creates in a user (example: me)

1. I thought the feature was simply broken.
2. I stumbled over the fact, that I could add a splitter in the default direction first, before the feature worked, got very annoyed, because there's no way to delete an undesired splitter.
3. I finally figured out the reason.
4. I figured out I could left-click a splitter-bubble to give focus to the _edit area_, so I could get around this.

# Solution

Append to the _edit area_-note:
"Click one of the blue bubbles first to be able to use the splitter-rotate feature.
Or better yet, unfocus the _custom table creator_ after clicking _Edit selected layout_."
Creator: DavidGretzschel

Title_Description:
FancyZones: "Cancel" should delete edits immediately In custom layouts, when editing a layout, adding a couple splitters or moving them, the changes appear to be saved, even when pressing cancel.
When switching to the Templates-tab and going back to Custom again, it will even go so far as to update the preview-icon.
However when one leaves the "choose your layout"-menu and opens it again later, the changes will indeed not have been saved.
But a user would not know this and might be very frustrated and confused, till he notices this.
Pretending to destroy someone's carefully hand-crafted layout is almost as bad as actually doing it.
Please don't.
Creator: DavidGretzschel

Title_Description:
Installer: WIXProj referenced VS enterprise edition ## 棣冩憫 Provide a description of the new feature

The installer can not be built according to the [documentation](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/tree/master/doc/devdocs#building-the-installers) when using Visual Studio Community. The reason is that the Visual Studio path is hardcoded at several places.

It would be great when the build scripts are able to handle different install locations the same way it is already done in the [Compiling PowerToys section](https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/tree/master/doc/devdocs#compiling-powertoys). A possible scenario is when using [Microsoft's Windows 10 development VM](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/downloads/virtual-machines/) for developing on the project. I do not know if the path depends on the subscription of the Visual Studio user.

---

If you'd like to see this feature implemented, add a 棣冩啢 reaction to this post.
Creator: rhorber

Multiple Dutch translation issues ## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 2.25.0
- PowerToy utility: Multiple
- Language: Dutch

## 棣冩憫 Provide where the issue is / 棣冩懖 Screenshots

1. PowerRename
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25853477/98940993-2feee800-24ec-11eb-86da-780658907727.png)

2. Enumerate items
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25853477/98940820-da1a4000-24eb-11eb-816e-cb44c3e8c876.png)

3. Info about PowerRename
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25853477/98941261-983dc980-24ec-11eb-92a1-f2c4168b254a.png)

4. Example is from PowerRename, but it's in each settings page (Kenmerk / Attribution)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25853477/98942412-3aaa7c80-24ee-11eb-9da2-8a399ab330ca.png)

5. Dark / Light / Windows default
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25853477/98942716-bc020f00-24ee-11eb-8f77-a23f8d5205f8.png)


### 閴 Actual phrase(s)

1: Voedingsnaam wijzigen
2: Items opsommen
3: Informatie over het wijzigen van de voedingsnaam
4: Kenmerk
5: Choose a mode / Dark / Light / Windows default / Windows color settings

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected phrase(s)

1: Power Rename
2: Items nummeren
3: Over PowerRename
4. Credits OR Met dank aan OR Referentie
5. Kies een modus / Donker / Licht / Windows standaard / Windows kleurinstellingen

### 閳 Why is the current translation wrong

1. "Voedingsnaam wijzigen" means something like: change the name of the power supply
2. "Items opsommen" means "Sum up items" while it's nog summing up anything, but just giving them a number
3. Again, "PowerRename" is translated as something like "information about changing the name of your power supply"
4. "Kenmerk" means something like a property of something. The English term "Attribution" is not that clear to me either. Is "Thanks to" or "Reference" better? Please note that this text is in almost each settings page.
5. No explanation needed.
Creator: luukfiets

Title_Description:
FanzyZones and multiple taskbar icons <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

# Environment

```
Windows build number: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18363.476]
PowerToys version: 0.14
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): FanzyZones
```

# Steps to reproduce

After installing 0.14; opened Edge (Chromium) in Canary, Developer, and Beta channels and it opened multiple windows for the browser and a new icon on the Taskbar.

Turning off PowerToys cleared the issue and Edge worked properly/as expected.

Tried to uninstall PT's from Control Panel and it would crash before completing.

Renamed the program directory and used the Settings>Apps area to uninstall with same results and then finally deleted the renamed folder to reinstall 0.13.

Problem cleared with 0.13 installed. 

# Expected behavior

Expect Edge to open just one instance versus multiple windows/instances.

# Actual behavior

After installing 0.14; opened Edge (Chromium) in Canary, Developer, and Beta channels and it opened multiple windows for the browser and a new icon on the Taskbar.

Turning off PowerToys cleared the issue and Edge worked properly/as expected.

Tried to uninstall PT's from Control Panel and it would crash before completing.

Renamed the program directory and used the Settings>Apps area to uninstall with same results and then finally deleted the renamed folder to reinstall 0.13.

Problem cleared with 0.13 installed. 

# Screenshots

https://twitter.com/WinObs/status/1201566610798075904?s=20
Creator: WinObs

Title_Description:
FancyZones 0.14.0 forces File > Open dialog (e.g., Notepad) to app's zone size <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

# Environment

```
Windows build number: Windows 10.0.18363.476.
PowerToys version: 0.14.0
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): FancyZones
```

# Steps to reproduce

<!-- A description of how to trigger this bug. -->

**File-Open**

1. Open Notepad.exe (or another application that uses a File-Open dialog).
2. Use Shift+Drag to move Notepad.exe into a zone.
3. Select File > Open.

**File-Save**

1. Open Notepad.exe.
2. Use Shift+Drag to move Notepad.exe into a zone.
3. Select File > Save As....

# Expected behavior

<!-- A description of what you're expecting, possibly containing screenshots or reference material. -->

**File-Open**
Notepad's File-Open dialog should be the same size as the previous time it was opened.

**File-Save**
Notepad's File-Save dialog should be rendered correctly (so that the filenames are visible).

# Actual behavior

<!-- What's actually happening? -->

**File-Open**
Notepad's File-Open dialog is the same size as the Notepad window and its display seems to have been prevented from rendering.

**File-Save**
Notepad's File-Save dialog's display seems to have been prevented from rendering.

# Screenshots

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

**File-Open**
![2019-12-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74487/69992722-f22dc500-150f-11ea-89b7-469c8de62dd4.png)

**File-Save**

Title_Description:
Switching active mouse buttons makes PowerToys malfunction  


## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 3 last versions
- PowerToy Utility: Fenzy Zones
- Running PowerToys as Admin: Indeed
- Windows build number: [run "winver"]

I tried installing multiple previous versions of Fency Zones, the same issue with all of them:
When your active mouse button is a right button (the opposite of left one which is commonly used for right handed peops) - Fency Zones, when you try to drag any window, immediately will the Zones for windows to adjust your dragging window into, even when you don't press any function activating button. If you press SHIFT - then the proposed zones disappear and you can just drag the window to where you need to. But you should be able to do it without pressing Shift.

Therefore, I am making the assumption that every version of Fency Zones has that issue which is taking the right mouse button as a left mouse button and as result activating the function when it's not needed.
I wish I'd know how to code - I'd fix it. Thanks

Title_Description:
Cast from char* to wchar_t* https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/blob/9b2f1a826da511196817d1219b1f402ba2c3f1ff/src/common/interop/two_way_pipe_message_ipc.cpp#L410-L410

From: https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/security/code-scanning/3?query=ref%3Arefs%2Fheads%2Fmaster

Conversion from unsigned char * to const_pointer. Use of invalid string can lead to undefined behavior.
CodeQL


This rule indicates a potentially incorrect cast from an byte string (char *) to a wide-character string (wchar_t *).

This cast might yield strings that are not correctly terminated; including potential buffer overruns when using such strings with some dangerous APIs.

Recommendation
Do not explicitly cast byte strings to wide-character strings.

For string literals, prepend the literal string with the letter "L" to indicate that the string is a wide-character string (wchar_t *).

For converting a byte literal to a wide-character string literal, you would need to use the appropriate conversion function for the platform you are using. Please see the references section for options according to your platform.

Example
In the following example, an byte string literal ("a") is cast to a wide-character string.
```

wchar_t* pSrc;

pSrc = (wchar_t*)"a"; // casting a byte-string literal "a" to a wide-character string
To fix this issue, prepend the literal with the letter "L" (L"a") to define it as a wide-character string.

```
References
General resources: std::mbstowcs
Microsoft specific resources: Security Considerations: International Features
Common Weakness Enumeration: CWE-704.
Creator: crutkas

Title_Description:
Fancy Zones Bug When Using 2 Monitors With Different Scaling # Environment

```
Windows build number:10.0.18362.295
PowerToys version: 0.14.1
PowerToy module for which you are reporting the bug (if applicable): Fancy Zones.
```

# Steps to reproduce

1. Attach 2 monitors to the System, both are 24 inch, but the resolution is 1080p/2k.
2. Set the 2k monitor as the primary monitor,  125% scaling. Put the 1080p monitor **vertically** on the **right** side, **100% scaling**.
3. Set Fancy Zones as 2 columns for both monitor, **set space around zones to 0**.
4. Open taskmgr, try to fit taskmgr in the right fancy zone on the left monitor.

# Expected behavior

Applications fit the right fancy zone.

# Actual behavior

Some applications (such like taskmgr) would not fit the right fancy zone on the left monitor, nor the left fancy zone on the right monitor.

# Screenshots

Sorry, would attach later.
Creator: simonlsp

Title_Description:
[FZ] Full-screen applications are minimized when opened ## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: .29.3
- PowerToy Utility: FancyZones
- Running PowerToys as Admin: Yes
- Windows build number: 19042.685

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. Use **1680x1050 full screen resolution on 1080p monitor for Apex Legends** (not required but issue occurs more frequently vs native res such as 1080 res on 1080p monitor).
2. Alt+tab from Apex Legends to desktop/another app, and then attempt to alt+tab back to game.
3. Disabling FancyZones eliminates the issue.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

Able to switch back to the game (e.g. alt+tab) & keep it focused.

### 閴 Actual result

Attempting to alt+tab from desktop to the game results in the game immediately minimizing from full screen, thus switching back to the desktop. Sometimes the result is an infinite loop of minimizing and maximizing of the game (or graphics corruption within game in windowed mode when it should be in full screen mode).

## 棣冩懖 Screenshots

Game window preview from taskbar is black with a small white outline rectangle in the bottom left instead of showing game render.
Creator: howiejc

Title_Description: Properly initialize STARTUPINFO There are a few places where we use `CreateProcess` passing a `STARTUPINFO` variable, let's make sure it's always initialized properly.
Creator: enricogior

Title_Description:
[FZ Editor] Text box value not highlighted when control receives focus via keyboard <!--
**Important: When reporting BSODs or security issues, DO NOT attach memory dumps, logs, or traces to Github issues**.
Instead, send dumps/traces to secure@microsoft.com, referencing this GitHub issue.
-->

## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 0.29.3
- PowerToy Utility: FancyZones
- Running PowerToys as Admin: N/A
- Windows build number: 10.0.19042.685

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. Open FancyZones Layout Editor
2. Use TAB key to navigate around controls in the editor window.
3. When focus lands on a text box control (**Space around zones** or **Distance to highlight adjacent zones** in the main window, and **Name** in the _Custom layout creator_ window), the value in the text box is not automatically selected (highlighted) as is standard for Windows apps.

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result

The value should be highlighted once the control gets focus, so that the user can simply start typing a new value, copy the existing value, etc.

### 閴 Actual result

The cursor is positioned at the start of the value, so if the user starts typing, their keystrokes are prepended to the existing value rather than replacing it.

Title_Description:
[spdlog] initialize logger to default null_sink This is relevant ~for https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/pull/9679 and also~ for FZ.

Initialize the logger to a default null sink and later, reset the sink to the desired value.
This allows to use the logger even if an error may have prevented to initialize it. The log entry will be lost but it won't cause a crash.
It is also OK for testing scenarios, where the logger is not yet initialized or it's not required in the first place.
Creator: enricogior

Title_Description:
[Image Resizer] "Unexpected property type or value I have some (what I think) normal sRGB Jpg images that Image Resizer refuses to resize, throwing up an error message "Unexpected property value or type". They were exported from a RAW file using my editor (ON1 Photo RAW).
## 閳 Computer information

- PowerToys version: 0.31.2
- PowerToy Utility: Image Resizer
- Running PowerToys as Admin: no
- Windows build number: [run "winver"] 20H2 - 19042.804

## 棣冩憫 Provide detailed reproduction steps (if any)

1. export from a RAW file using ON1 Photo RAW as sRGB JPG file
2. right-click resulting JPG and choose "Resize pictures" (I tried all the default sizes)
3. Image Resizer gives dialog box "Can't resize the following pictures...Unexpected property type or value."
4. Open the JPG file in Irfanview (free image viewer with some editing/resizing capabilities) and then saved it from there
5. Same result when I tried to use Image Resizer on the file saved by Irfanview
6. Opened the file in Windows Photos, went into Edit and then saved a copy.
7. Image Resizer was able to resize the photo saved from Windows Photos
8. Stepping through Windows Photos is far from ideal because image gets a quality reduction

### 閴佹棑绗 Expected result
I have never had a problem before with any viewer or editor handling a JPG file. I would hope that Image Resizer would resize the file, I guess :-)

### 閴 Actual result

Image Resizer fails to reduce the image

Title_Description:
[Run][Plugin Manager] UI: Open Settings on first start could result in empty plugin list _We have now   implemented a plugin management for PT Run into the settings ux. (PR #9872;   Issue #5273)_

### Bug
If the user opens settings to fast and PT Run isn't completely initialized then the plugin list is empty and shows a warning that at least one plugin has to be enabled.
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61519853/109005263-0bd5a200-76aa-11eb-8969-6d3831e8a5a2.png)

The reason ist, that the list in `C:\Users\Heiko\AppData\Local\Microsoft\PowerToys\PowerToys Run\settings.json` is generated by PT Run on its first start and settings opened before the json is ready.

This can be reproduced by deleting the json, starting PT and directly open settings.

#### Suggested Solution
Add a text that is shown when no plugins are available to display (instead of an empty list and the error text): `<circle dots> PT Run is initializing. Please come back in a few minutes.`

#### Additional comments
- It is not expected that this does happen. https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/9653#issuecomment-785150401
- If possible we should fix this instead of adding an information message for the user. https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/issues/9653#issuecomment-785206773

---
This is a remaining work item form issue #9653.
Creator: htcfreek
